loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Activas, tiene 12 integrantes, es un grupo unido y capáz de realizar actividades conjuntamente que fortalecen su compañerismo.
La sra. Griselda, una de las integrantes del grupo, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, con esta actividad ella aporta a su canasta familiar, desea poder ofrecer mayor variedad de frutas y verduras a su clientela, tener mas mercaderías y generar mayor ingreso.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de variedades de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The committee named “Mujeres Activas” (Active Women) has 12 members. It is a close-knit and capable group that works together on activities in order to strengthen the camaraderie among its members.

Sra. Griselda is one of the members of this group. She sells fruits and vegetables, which helps her to feed her family. Griselda wants to offer a wider variety of fruits and vegetables to her customers, so she hopes to have more merchandise and generate more income as a result. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy a variety of fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Santa Maria. Group

texts.es:
El comité "Santa María" tiene 10 integrantes, se encuentra en su 2° ciclo, al culminar e 1° ciclo se encontraron muy conforme con el respaldo de la fundación, se las ve entusiasmadas en continuar con este apoyo ya que salieron favorecidas y aprovecharon al máximo el crédito anterior.
María Rosa, una de las integrantes del grupo, tiene una despensa, la cual desea surtir con mayor variedad de productos que poder ofrecer a su clientela y también anhela poder agrandar su despensa, todo esto para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de sus clientes y generar mayor ingreso a su canasta familiar.
Solicita el crédito para poder surtir su despensa con lácteos, verduras, hortalizas, etc.
texts.en:
The "Santa María" communal bank has 10 members and is in its second cycle. Upon finishing the first cycle they found themselves very satisfied with the support of the foundation. They are enthusiastic about continuing with this support since they came out well and took maximum advantage of the previous loan. 

María Rosa, one of the members of the group, has a small grocery store that she wants to stock with a greater variety of products that she can offer her customers. She also wants to be able to enlarge her store. All of this is to satisfy the basic needs of her customers and generate more income for her household. 

She is asking for the loan in order to be able to stock her store with milk products, vegetables, etc.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, milk products, and bread products

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité San Cayetano esta conformado por mujeres que viven todas en el mismo barrio.Las integrantes del comité se encuentran muy entusiasmadas con el programa y por ello con mucha responsabilidad van adquiriendo los créditos para volver a re invertir en sus negocios y también ayudar a sus familiares. 
Una de las integrantes, la señora Francisca se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como frutas, verduras, lácteos, panificados, gaseosas, etc.
El pedido del crédito se sería para fortalecer su negocio con la compra de mayor cantidad de mercaderías para poder crecer y aumentar las ventas del negocio.
.
texts.en:
The San Cayetano communal bank is made up of women who all live in the same neighborhood. The members of the group are very enthusiastic about the program. Because of that, they continue taking loans in a very responsible way in order to reinvest again in their businesses and also to help their families.

One of the members, Francisca, sells staple goods such as fruit, vegetables, milk products, bread products, soft drinks, etc. 

The loan will be used to strengthen her business with the purchase of a greater quantity of merchandise in order to be able to grow and increase the business' sales.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as milk products, bread products, fruit, and vegetables

loans.name: Mercedes Del

texts.es:
Mercedes, solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio y de esta manera poder continuar trabajando, se comprará dos Fardos de ropa americana, ya que su fuerte en el negocio está en la venta de ropa americana, la cual la compra por mayor.

Este préstamo le permitirá generar una condición estable en el negocio al igual que la inversión anterior, ya que al momento se ha mantenido con su buen número de clientes y continua prosperando en el comercio.
texts.en: Mercedes requests a loan to invest in the business and continue working.  She will buy two bundles of American clothes since her business is based on reselling American clothes that she buys at wholesale.  This loan will allow her to generate a stable business condition just like her previous investment did since she’s retained her good number of customers to date and continues prospering in commerce.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of American clothes.

loans.name: Edith Maribel

texts.es:
Edith, está solicitando un préstamo la compra de productos de primera necesidad, para el negocio que actualmente administra, su compra será el azúcar, frijoles, arroz, aceite, golosinas, bebidas y papel higiénico, y otra mercadería que es demandada por los clientes.

El préstamo anterior le permitió aumentar el inventario y las  ventas, logró también mejorar sus ganancias y mantener la preferencia de muchos clientes, esta motivado a continuar trabajando a través de estos financiamientos ya que considera que crece en la zona.
texts.en: Edith is requesting a loan to buy basic staples for the store she currently manages.  She will buy sugar, beans, rice, oil, snacks, beverages, toilet paper and other merchandise her customers are requesting.  Her previous loan allowed her to increase inventory and sales.  She also managed to improve profits and retain many customers.  She’s motivated to continue working by means of these loans because she believes that she’s growing in the zone.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Jose German

texts.es:
JOSE TIENE 20 AÑOS DE EDAD ES CASADO CON LA ESPOSA Y CON CON LOS HIJOS VIVEN EN LA CUIDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RIOS.

LA VENTANILLA EL LAUREL SE ENCUENTRAS UBICADA EN EL RECINTO EL ALUREL DE LA PARROQUIA ZAPOTAL NUEVO PERTENECIENTE AL CANTON VENTANAS SE DEDICA A LABORES AGRICOLAS

JOSE SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE MAIZ, ARROZ Y FREJOL ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE GALLINAS Y CERDOS, CON CREDITO LE AYUDADO A INVERTIR EN SEMILLAS, ABONOS, Y FERTILIZANTES PARA LOS CULTIVOS Y EN BALANCEADO PARA LOS ANIMALES.  EL CREDITO ES DE GRAN AYUDA PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION.

EL SUEÑO ES TENER DINERO PARA CONSTRUIR LA CASA.

LE GUSTA HACER DEPORTE CON LA FAMILIA.
texts.en:
José, 20, is married living with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  The “Laurel” communal bank is located in Recinto El Laurel in Zapotal Nuevo Parish belonging to Ventanas Canton; it’s involved with agricultural work.

José is a corn, rice and broad bean farmer and he also raises chickens and pigs.  The loan has helped him buy seeds, manure and fertilizer for his crops and feed for his animals.  The loan is of great help to increase production.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es: Carmela  es una humilde habitante de la comarca La cuesta, Teustepe, viuda  ella se dedica a la compra y venta de pan, negocio que ha comercializado en la misma localidad en la que habita desde hace 5 años, durante ese tiempo fue  ahorrando con sacrificio y dedicación sus ganancias para poder comprarse  una vaca, aunque sus hijos ya estén casados y con sus propias responsabilidades ella afirma que económicamente la apoyan con lo poco que  pueden. Ella solicita crédito Kiva para invertir en compra de productos plásticos como panas, porras, vasos, platos, tenedores, cucharas etc. para dedicarse a este nuevo negocio de venta de utensilios de cocina. Ella espera mejorar sus ingresos una vez que pague este crédito, quiere invertir en la compra de una vaca pata reproducir leche y cuajada.
texts.en:
Carmela is a modest inhabitant of the La Cuesta region. A widow, she buys and sells bread, a business she has been running in the same locality where she lives for the past five years. During that time, she has been saving her earnings with sacrifice and dedication in order to purchase a cow. Although her children are now married and have their own responsibilities, she states that they help her financially with the little that they can.

She is requesting a Kiva loan to invest in plastic products, such as bowls, pots, cups, plates, forks, spoons, etc, in order to engage in a new business selling cooking utensils. She plans to improve her income and, once she pays off this loan, wants to invest in buying a cow in order to produce milk and curd.

loans.use: to buy plastic products such as bowls, pots, cups, plates, forks and spoons.

loans.name: Santiago Desiderio

texts.es:
Santiago Desiderio tiene 53 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Santiago Desiderio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, ademas se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral. l

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos y poder arrendar más terreno y pago a jornaleros. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas.

Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría economicamente en los gastos de la familiay comprar insumos. El sueño es tener un capital propio para trabajar en las tierras. En el tiempo libre le gusta ir de pesca y cacería.
texts.en:
Santiago Desiderio is 53 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.

The name of this solidarity group is VRC San Francisco de Sibimbe. It is located in the district of Sibimbe, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas. This group comprises twenty members, who are short-cycle corn and rice farmers.

Santiago Desiderio is a farmer. He grows corn and rice, and he also raises pigs and fowl.

He is requesting the loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizers, and so that he can rent more land and pay the laborers. He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas. This loan would help him financially to cover family expenses and buy supplies. His dream is to have have enough capital to work his own land. 

He enjoys going fishing and hunting in his spare time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers, and also to rent more land and pay laborers.

loans.name: Christian Patricio

texts.es:
Christian Patricio tiene 26 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Christian Patricio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas cada mes.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. El sueño es   salir adelante con la esposa y los hijos.

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Christian Patricio, 26, is married and lives with his wife and children in Ventanas canton in Los Ríos province. The communal bank SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE is located in Sibimbe in Ventanas canton. The group has 20 members who do seasonal farmwork such as planting corn and rice. Christian Patricio is a farmer who plants corn. He makes his purchase and sells his products in Ventanas each month.

He is requesting this loan to buy seed, fertilizer, urea, pesticide, and manure. The loan will help him meet his financial needs. His dream is to support his wife and children, and he likes to play sports in his free time.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, urea, pesticide, and manure.

loans.name: Mario Luis

texts.es: Mario con su anterior credikiva, compró pintura, madera, pegante, puntillas y una máquina sierra  sin fin, su proceso ha mejorado, los cortes los hacen de manera más efectiva,  tiene más eficiencia en   su tiempo productivo y da un acabado especial al producto terminado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, con el cuan comprará materias primas e insumos como madera, sellador, pintura y pegantes.  Con esta inversión ampliará su capacidad de producción y trabajará sobre pedidos que han realizado sus clientes, él aprovechará su ubicación estratégica para captar la atención de su potencial clientela a través de nuevos diseños a la medida de sus compradores. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente: “Gracias por haber confiado  en mi su crédito fue de mucha ayuda para mi negocio espero que me sigan apoyando.”
texts.en: Mario used his previous Kiva loan to buy paint, lumber, glue, nails and an electric band saw.  His process has improved and the cuts are done more efficiently.  His production time is also more efficient and his finishing touches are special.  He’s currently applying for a new Kiva loan to buy raw materials like lumber, sealant, paint and adhesives.  With this investment he will increase his production capability and will work on pending customer orders.  He will take advantage of his strategic location to attract the attention of potential customers by means of new designs to customer specs.  His message to lenders is the following: “Thanks for having trusted me with the loan; it was of great help for my business and I hope that you will continue supporting me.”

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para la compra de materiales para la elaboración de tamales y enchiladas, este préstamo le brinda los recursos necesarios para invertir en aceite, maíz, condimentos, utensilios plásticos, y otros productos que pueda utilizar para sus ventas.
El préstamo anterior le ayudó a mejorar el negocio incrementando los materiales y teniéndolos a la mano para aumentar la producción sus ventas, esto ha motivado para que continúe trabajando a través de los préstamos que se financian con kiva.
texts.en:
Rosalina has decided to take a new loan in order to purchase materials for making tamales and enchiladas. This loan provides her with the necessary resources to invest in oil, corn, condiments, plastic utensils, and other products that she can use for her sales. 

The previous loan helped her to improve her business, increasing materials and having them on hand in order to increase production and sales. This has motivated her to continue working via loans financed with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase oil, corn, condiments, and plastic utensils

loans.name: Nueva Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité Nueva Alegría esta conformada por mujeres que se dedican a actividades varias algunas son costureras, otras comerciantes, otras trabajan como empleadas domésticas pero al mismo tiempo se complementan. El comité es nuevo se encuentra en su 1er ciclo y de igual forma existe mucho entusiasmo, alegría y ganas de salir adelante. 
La señora Ilda es costurera, arregla todo tipo de prendas y también confecciona todo tipo de prendas. La señora con el tiempo ha podido ganar experiencia y sobre todo reconocimiento de su clientes por la dedicación, entrega a tiempo y buen precio.
El crédito solicitado sería para comprar los materiales como telas, tijeras, agujas, cintas, etc para poder ofrecer variedades y así generar mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
The Nueva Alegría group is made up of women representing various business activities. Some are seamstresses, others work as merchants or domestic employees, but they all complement each other well. Nueva Alegría is a new group in its first loan cycle, and its members are enthusiastic, happy and eager to put their loans to good use.

Ilda is a seamstress, she sews and mends many different types of clothing. Over time, she has gained considerable experience and more importantly, a good reputation among her customers for her dedication, for always finishing her work on time, and for her good prices. The loan Ilda is requesting will be used to buy materials such as fabric, scissors, ribbons, etc. so that she can earn more income by offering a greater variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric, scissors, ribbon, etc.

loans.name: 04.5.4 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Thủy is 33 years old and is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. For the past five years, Thủy has run a tailoring business and her main business hardship is the lack of capital. She joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2009 to improve her business and she has successfully repaid three previous loans. Thủy is the group leader of a four-member loan group called the 4.5.4 Nam NGạn solidarity group. 

Thủy is requesting a loan to purchase machines to do tailor-made and clothing repair. She will use the profit from her loan to provide for her kids and to help them do well in school. Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase machines to do tailor-made and clothing repair

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a very enterprising woman who generates income for her family from her businesses. She sells cooked food from home and at retail, delivering individual orders to individual customers. She sells on credit and gets payment back weekly, biweekly, or monthly depending on the agreement with her customer. 

She started working as a merchant three years ago. She wants to continually improve her businesses, but her working capital is no longer sufficient to support growth, especially during times when her businesses' turnover increases. This is why Luvuno has sought out a Kiva loan through her third financing experience with Yehu Microfinance Trust. With it, she will buy stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice to fill her customers' orders and make sure they have the best food she can provide.

loans.use: to buy stocks of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and rice.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo de 45 años invirtió su anterior credikiva en materias primas y con ello aumentó el número de almuerzos y productos de panadería que vendió  rápidamente, rotando una vez más su capital de trabajo. Él también logró ampliar el surtido de su oferta y agregó  construcciones a su base de clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, para aumentar el volumen de sus compras en materias primas como arroz, aceites, harina y ganar descuentos que trasladará a sus utilidades, su inversión tendrá éxito porque aprovechará el punto estratégico en el cual se encuentra para impactar el mercado de trasportadores en motocicletas, que es en resumidas cuentas donde quiere llegar, porque  le representa un número importante de potenciales clientes. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Gracias por el apoyo en mi negocio ya que así he logrado llevar mejores utilidades al hogar”
texts.en:
Pablo, 45, used his previous Kiva loan to buy raw materials and increased the number of lunches and baked goods that he sold quickly rotating his working capital once more.  He also managed to widen his selection of offers and added more construction sites to his customer base.  
He’s currently applying for a new Kiva loan to increase the volume of his purchases of raw materials like rice, oil and flour to qualify for discounts that he’ll pass on to his profits.  His investment will be successful because he will take advantage of the strategic location he has to impact the market motorcycle delivery services entails which is where he wants to get because they represent an important source of potential customers.  His message to Kiva lenders is the following:  “Thanks for supporting my business because I’ve managed thus to bring higher profits home.”

loans.use: to buy raw materials like rice, oil and flour.

loans.name: Shirly Maria

texts.es: Shirly madre de 4 hijos en las edades, con quienes habita   en el municipio de Soledad,  es la propietaria de una tienda y comercializa abarrotes,  ranchos, víveres, artículos de la canasta familiar, y productos de papelería en general.  Después de 4 años de experiencia con los negocios de su familia, aprendió a comercializar muy rápido y emprendió su propia aventura emprendedora.  Su venta de mostrador, la realiza diariamente, una parte de contado y la otra a crédito. Ella abre las puertas de su local desde las 7 de la mañana y las cierra a las 9 de la noche y sus compras las realiza en las centrales de abasto de la ciudad de Barranquilla desde mucho más temprano y de contado. Sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su sector, especialmente amas de casa que compran en pequeñas cantidades lo que   necesita para  elaborar el alimento diario de su familia en porciones de onzas, media libra, un cuarto y muchas veces en unidades que piden a Shirley. Su meta es lograr un mayor posicionamiento en el sector y convertir su negocio en un granero distribuidor. Su mayor anhelo es lograr hacer ahorros, para conseguir el subsidio de vivienda que requiere del estado y esto es lo que justamente se propone aumentando su capacidad de ventas, con los créditos de su credikiva bien invertidos para gradualmente  lograrlo. Por eso con este su primer financiamineto comprará ranchos, víveres, artículos de la canasta familiar, y productos de papelería en generalen mayor volumen para ganar descuentos con sus proveedores y ahorrar en sus compras, para ser mas competitiva.
texts.en:
Shirly is mother to 4 children of various ages who live with her in the city of Soledad. She owns a store where she sells groceries, household staples, and stationery. After 4 years of experience in her family's business, she quickly learned how to operate a business and started her own. She sells from her counter each day for both cash and credit. She opens the doors at 7 a.m. and closes them at 9 p.m. She purchases her merchandise from warehouses in the city of Barranquilla very early and for cash. Her main customers are her neighbors, in particular, the homemakers who purchase small quantities--ounces, quarter or half pounds, or specific weights they request from Shirly--to make the family's daily meals. 

Shirly's goal is to have a bigger location in the area and to become a grain dealer. Her great wish is to save so that she is elegible for the government housing subsidy. This is why she proposes to increase her sales. By investing the Kiva loan well, she feels she will gradually reach this goal. Therefore, she will use this first loan to buy groceries, household staple items, and stationery in larger quantities so that she can get discounts from suppliers, can save on her purchases, and be more competitive.

loans.use: to buy groceries, household staple items, and stationery.

loans.name: Primero De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité Primero de Diciembre esta conformado por un grupo de señoras amigas y vecinas de la misma comunidad. Es un grupo muy unido y responsable ya que entre todas se ayudan a pagar los gastos.Las integrantes del grupo son muy solidarias, emprendedoras y sobre todo luchadoras ya que con los ingresos que generan ayudan a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familiares.
Una de las integrantes la señora Blanca es casada y tiene 3 hijos, se dedica a la artesanía hace cántaros, borda hamacas, sábanas, etc con materiales típicos del país.
El crédito solicitado sería para cubrir el gasto de los materiales como hilos, agujas, telas, encajes, etc. y también lo utilizaría para ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank Primero de Diciembre comprises a group of female friends who are all neighbors residing in the same community. It is a very close and responsible group, and they all help each other pay for expenses. The members of this group are very supportive of each other. They are enterprising women and, above all, they are fighters, because they use the income they generate to help improve their families' quality of life.

Blanca is one of its members. She is married and has three children. She works making crafts such as clay jugs, and embroiders hammocks, sheets, etc. with typical regional materials.

The loan requested will go towards covering expenses for supplies such as thread, needles, fabric, lace, etc. She will also use it to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, lace, and fabric.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is from Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Philippines. She is 51 years old, married, and has 3 children. To make a living, Lucia provides transportation within the local community using her motor cab. She has been in this business for 12 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Lucia joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her existing vehicle so she can provide better service. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business improvement to meet the daily needs of her family.

loans.use: to repair her motor cab

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael lives in Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has three children. For the past four years, Michael has owned a retail shop that he started from a savings scheme where individuals contribute a certain amount and the total is lent to one person in turn. Michael learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined to access credit to improve his business operations. Michael's main challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, seasonal weather, and purchasing stock.

Michael is requesting a 41,850 KES loan to buy stock and pay for his children’s school fees. He will use the extra income from his loan to add to his savings to build rental houses. In the future, Michael hopes to purchase a piece of land and continue to provide education for her education.

loans.use: to buy retail stock and pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Maitha

texts.en:
Maitha lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. For the past three years, Maitha has owned a timber workshop. He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined to access credit to improve his business operations. Maitha's main business challenges are high transport and fuel prices and purchasing stock.

Maitha is requesting a 26,250 KES loan to buy timber for his business. He will use the extra income from his loan to add to his savings and expand his business. In the future, Maitha aspires to open other timber workshops in the area.

loans.use: to buy timber for his business

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel, 42, is a married entrepreneur in Tuburan, Aloran, Philippines. He has 3 children and earns 13,000 PHP per month by raising and selling ducks. He started this business almost 5 years ago, and in 2008 he joined GDMPC Micro Credit to help him grow and improve his business. Joel is borrowing 20,000 PHP to put towards the purchase of livestock feed and other supplies for his ducks. He’s hopeful that before long he will be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for his flock of ducks.

loans.name: José

texts.es: José de 26 años de edad vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia a orillas del Mar Caribe, con su familia conformada por su cónyuge y su hija de 6 años de edad. En este ambiente de playa, brisa y mar,  José tiene una tienda donde vende artículos de la canasta familiar al detalle, en los precios y las medidas que la clientela alrededor de su barrio, necesita para consumirlo diariamente. El sector donde se encuentra ubicado José es muy popular, su negocio  no tiene competencia  y él necesita aprovechar esa fortaleza en el mercado, pues desde hace 2 años en los cuales inició su clientela ha surgido y la tendencia a sus ventas se incrementa en escala ascendente. La historia de superación de José  es una bonita, porque de extracción humilde y campesina llegó a la ciudad de Barranquilla, buscando un mejor futuro hace 10 años y comenzó a trabajar como empleado doméstico, posteriormente fue auxiliar de tienda y con sus propios ahorros y un préstamo que le hizo su patrón, dio apertura a sui propio negocio. Su éxito se debe a todo el conocimiento que tiene desde que fue empleado, en especial lo del trato amable y precios bajos. Recientemente incursionó en la línea de venta al por mayor en otros negocios y ha tenido mucha acogida. Su meta ahora es implementar el servicio a domicilio, en el cual tiene también experiencia. Definitivamente Jose es una de esas personas que con poca formación académica tienen  “olfato para los negocios”. En la actualidad sus sueño de prosperidad empresarial no cesan y está aplicando a su primer credikiva, que también es el primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará mercancía como abarrotes, víveres, ranchos, refrescos y en general artículos de la canasta familiar, pues aspira a comprar en un mayor volumen para obtener descuentos especiales y continuar compitiendo con precios bajos y vendiendo al por mayor y al detal.
texts.en:
José, 26, lives in the town of Puerto Colombia on the shores of the Caribbean Sea with his family composed of his wife and six-year-old daughter.  In this environment of beach, breeze and sea, José has a store where he sells basic staples needed for daily consumption at retail at prices and in ways his neighborhood customers can afford and manage.  The sector José is located in is very popular and his store has no competition so he needs to take advantage of this market strength.  In the two years since he started, clientele has grown and his sales are on a rising trend.

José’s personal growth story is a beautiful one because he’s from very humble, rural origins.  He arrived in the city of Barranquilla looking for a better future ten years ago and started working as a domestic employee.  He then became a helper in a store and used his own savings and a loan he got from his boss to open his own business.  

His success is due to all the knowledge he’s gotten ever since he was an employee, especially relating to kind service and low prices.  He recently ventured into wholesale sales in other businesses and he’s been very well-received.  His goal now is to start home delivery service in which he also has experience.

Definitely, José is one of those people who despite their poor academic background have “a nose for business.”  His dream at present is that his business prosperity does not cease and he’s using his first Kiva loan, his first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy merchandise like groceries, foodstuffs, snacks, soft-drinks and basic staple items in general because he aims at buying in large amounts to qualify for volume purchase special discounts and continue competing with low prices and selling at wholesale and retail.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock his store.

loans.name: Cesar Ceferino

texts.es:
CESAR TIENE 28 AÑOS DE EDAD ES CASADO CON LA ESPOSA Y CON CON LOS HIJOS VIVEN EN LA CUIDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RIOS.

LA VENTANILLA EL LAUREL SE ENCUENTRAS UBICADA EN EL RECINTO EL ALUREL DE LA PARROQUIA ZAPOTAL NUEVO PERTENECIENTE AL CANTON VENTANAS SE DEDICA A LABORES AGRICOLAS

CESAR SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE MAIZ, ARROZ Y FREJOL ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE GALLINAS Y CERDOS, CON CREDITO LE AYUDADO A INVERTIR EN SEMILLAS, ABONOS, Y FERTILIZANTES PARA LOS CULTIVOS Y EN BALANCEADO PARA LOS ANIMALES.  EL CREDITO ES DE GRAN AYUDA PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION.

EL SUEÑO ES TENER SALUD Y VIDA PARA SEGUIR TRABAJANDO PARA DAR TODO A SU HIJO.

EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES LE GUSTA HACER DEPORTE CON LA FAMILIA.
texts.en:
César, 28, is married living with his wife and two children in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  The “El Laurel” communal bank is located in Recinto El Laurel in Zapotal Nuevo Parish belonging to Ventanas Canton; it’s involved with agricultural activities.

César grows corn, rice and broad beans and also raises chickens and pigs.  The loan has helped him buy seeds, manure and fertilizer for the crops and feed for the animals.  The loan is a great help to increase production.

His dream is to have good health and life to continue working to give everything to his son.  He likes playing sports with his family in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy seeds, farm supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Tilman

texts.es: Tilman está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, pues con el anterior logró un mejor funcionamiento de su restaurante de comidas rápidas, y almuerzos, pues compró en un mayor volumen, materia prima e insumos que ampliaron su oferta y atendiendo mucho más las necesidades de su clientela. Con su nuevo credikiva, comprará sillas plásticas, y mesas, pues las actuales están hechas en madera y se encuentran es estado de deterioro, quitándole presentación a su negocio y el confort a su clientela, así mismo comprará una parrilla  de acero, para asados de carne y pollo al carbón. Su inversión planea tener éxito porque cuenta con una clientela fija y un potencial que explorar, y con su inversión ofrecerá productos de una gran variedad alimentaria. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es que: gracias a Kiva ha podido potencializar su negocio y llevarlo al punto que es uno de los mejores en el barrio.
texts.en:
Tilman is applying for a new Kiva loan because the previous one made it possible for him to attain better functioning of his fast-food and lunch restaurant.  He purchased raw materials and ingredients in larger volume which expanded his menu and allowed him to tend to his customers’ needs much more.  

He will use his new Kiva loan to buy plastic tables and chairs because his current ones are wood and they are in poor shape detracting from his business’ appearance and customer comfort.  He will also buy a steel grill to charcoal grill meat and chicken.  

His investment will be successful because he has a regular clientele and potential to explore and with his investment he will offer a great variety of food options.  His message to Kiva lenders is: thanks to Kiva I’ve been able to make the business a reality and take it to the point where it’s one of the neighborhood’s best.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs, tables and a steel grill.

loans.name: Amelia Pilar

texts.es:
AMELIA TIENE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD VIVE EN UNION LIBRE CON EL COMPAÑERO Y CON CON LOS HIJOS VIVEN EN LA CUIDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RIOS.

LA VENTANILLA EL LAUREL SE ENCUENTRAS UBICADA EN EL RECINTO EL ALUREL DE LA PARROQUIA ZAPOTAL NUEVO PERTENECIENTE AL CANTON VENTANAS SE DEDICA A LABORES AGRICOLAS

AMELIA SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE MAIZ, ARROZ Y FREJOL ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE GALLINAS Y CERDOS, CON CREDITO LE AYUDADO A INVERTIR EN SEMILLAS, ABONOS, Y FERTILIZANTES PARA LOS CULTIVOS Y EN BALANCEADO PARA LOS ANIMALES.  EL CREDITO ES DE GRAN AYUDA PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION.

EL SUEÑO DE AMELIA ES MEJORAR LOS CULTIVOS PARA TENER MAS PRODUCION Y CON LAS GANANCIAS COMPRAR UNA CASA.

EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES LE GUSTA DESCANZAR.
texts.en:
Amelia, 40, is in a common law relationship living with her spouse and children in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  The “El Laurel” communal bank is located in Recinto El Laurel in Zapotal Nuevo Parish belonging to Ventanas Canton; it’s involved with agricultural activities.

Amelia grows corn, rice and broad beans and also raises chickens and pigs.  The loan has helped him buy seeds, manure and fertilizer for the crops and feed for the animals.  The loan is a great help to increase production.

Amelia’s dream is to improve the crops to have more production and use profits to buy a house.  She likes resting in her free time.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: Cecilia Rosalia

texts.es:
Cecilia Rosalia tiene 27 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz..

Cecilia Rosalia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, además se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y cerdos. Las compras y las ventas las realiza en Ventanas cada mes.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, urea, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir  necesidades. El sueño es tener un capital propio.

En los tiempo libres se dedica a pasar con la familia.
texts.en: Cecilia Rosalia is 27 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their two children in the Ventanas canton in the province of Los Ríos. The communal bank she belongs to is called VRC San Francisco de Sibimbe and is located in the Sibimbe precinct in the Ventanas canton. It boasts twenty members who are all engaged in short-cycle agricultural activities: they grow sweetcorn and rice. Cecilia Rosalia, on top of growing sweetcorn and rice, raises hens and pigs. She buys and sells in Ventana each month. She asks for this loan in order to buy seeds, urea, fertiliser and manure. The loan will help her by giving her the funds to buy these supplies she needs. Her dream is to have enough funds of her own one day. Her spare time is spent with her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertiliser and manure.

loans.name: John Michael

texts.en:
John Michael is single with one child. He is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines.

To earn a living, John Michael operates a service-based business, providing transportation to local community members. He has been doing this for 3 years and every month he earn 10,000 PHP from his work. He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to repair his vehicle so he can avoid better service.

John Michael been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, he hopes to help his child finish school, and to double the amount of income he is able to earn in his business.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chemicals, wood, and equipment for her religious articles.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.en:
Sergia is a widow with one child. She is 65 years old and resides at Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Sergia owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been five years in this business. Each month, she earns PHP 6,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. 

In 2009, Sergia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Sergia wants to build a house and wants her child to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Cruz Antonia

texts.es:
Cruz Antonia tiene 51 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Cruz Antonia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz,arroz, además se dedican a la crianza de patos. Las comprar y las ventas las realiza en Ventanas cada mes.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de urea, semillas, abonos, fertilizantes. Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para los cultivos. El desafio al que se enfrenta sonn las plagas el cogoller y la lancha. El sueño es poder salir adelante con la familia. En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicar más tiempo a la familia.
texts.en:
Cruz Antonia is 51 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The Communal Bank “San Francisco de Sibimbe” is located in the neighborhood of Recinto Sibimbe in the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank has 20 members who engage in short-cycle farming. They grow corn and rice.

Cruz Antonia is a farmer who grows corn and rice. In addition, she raises ducks. Her purchases and sales are conducted in Ventanas each month.

Cruz Antonia is requesting a loan to buy urea, seeds, compost, and fertilizers. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to buy what she needs for her crops. Her greatest challenge is battling pests such as earworms and fungi. Cruz Antonia’s dream is to move forward with her family. In her free time, she enjoys spending more time with them.

loans.use: to buy urea, seeds, compost, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Oscar Alejandro

texts.es:
OSCAR TIENE 19 AÑOS DE EDAD ES CASADO CON LA ESPOSA Y CON CON LOS HIJOS VIVEN EN LA CUIDAD DE VENTANAS PROVINCIA DE LOS RIOS.

LA VENTANILLA EL LAUREL SE ENCUENTRAS UBICADA EN EL RECINTO EL ALUREL DE LA PARROQUIA ZAPOTAL NUEVO PERTENECIENTE AL CANTON VENTANAS SE DEDICA A LABORES AGRICOLAS

OSCAR SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA A LA SIEMBRA DE MAIZ, ARROZ Y FREJOL ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE GALLINAS Y CERDOS, CON CREDITO LE AYUDADO A INVERTIR EN SEMILLAS, ABONOS, Y FERTILIZANTES PARA LOS CULTIVOS Y EN BALANCEADO PARA LOS ANIMALES.  EL CREDITO ES DE GRAN AYUDA PARA AUMENTAR LA PRODUCCION.

EL SUEÑO ES TENER DINERO PARA HACER LA CASA.
LE GUSTA HACER DEPORTE CON LA FAMILIA.
texts.en:
Oscar, 19, is married living with his wife and children in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.  The “El Laurel” communal bank is located in Recinto El Laurel in Zapotal Nuevo Parish belonging to Ventanas Canton; it’s involved with agricultural activities.

Oscar grows corn, rice and broad beans and also raises chickens and pigs.  The loan has helped him buy seeds, manure and fertilizer for the crops and feed for the animals.  The loan is a great help to increase production.

His dream is to have money to build a house.  He likes playing sports with his family.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and animal feed.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
For over three years, Sylvia has made a living by operating a general store that sells a variety of food and home-use products in Lopez Jaena, Philippines. She is 63 years old, married, and is the mother of 10 children. Sylvia earns 6,000 PHP a month through her store.

In 2008, Sylvia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that can help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP so she can purchase new items such as candies, Milo (a popular powdered milk drink), shampoo, and soap. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase store items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, and soap.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Don salvador, tiene 64 años de edad, está casado, tiene 7 hijos, vive en el municipio de Bonito Oriental junto a su esposa, una hija y un nieto.
Hace 5 años estableció su propia fuente de ingresos, dedicándose a la venta de medicinas naturales y condimentos. Él compra el producto y lo prepara en ristras en bolsitas, las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante en diferentes aldeas, ofreciendo: anís, romero, manzanilla, algodón, canela, clavo de olor, pimienta, cominos, ajos, etc. el préstamo que solicita es de 8,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar más productos medicinales y condimentos para vender, ya que al tener variedad de productos va incrementar sus ventas. Su objetivo es continuar trabajando duro para obtener los ingresos necesarios para la manutención de su familia.
texts.en:
Salvador, 64, is married and has seven children; he lives in the town of Bonito Oriental with his wife, daughter and grandson.  He establishes his own source of income five years ago selling natural remedies and condiments.  He buys the products and packages it in strips of little bags and sells them from place to place in different villages.  He sells anise, rosemary, chamomile, cotton, cinnamon, cloves, pepper, cumin, garlic, etc.

He’s asking for an 8,000 Lempira loan to buy more medicinal products and condiments to sell because a wider variety to sell means increased sales.  
His goal is to continue working hard to earn income needed to support his family.

loans.use: to buy chamomile, rosemary, anise, garlic, cinnamon, cloves, pepper, cotton, etc.

loans.name: Hector Eduardo

texts.es:
Hector, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en la reparación de su vivienda, comprándose lámina y madera, ya que su objetivo es mantener en buenas condiciones la vivienda y sobre todo el techo que le de la seguridad a su familia de protegerse del sol y la lluvia.

Con el préstamo anterior el manifiesta haber tenido el apoyo necesario con los insumos agrícolas y al mismo tiempo está aplicación permitió un cultivo de maíz más provechoso, obteniendo una buena cosecha, sus condiciones a la familia han mejorado ya que han contado con lo necesario para la alimentación.
texts.en: Hector decided to take out a new loan in order to repair his house. To this end, he wants to buy roofing sheets and wood, since his goal is to keep his house in good repair, especially the roof, which keeps his family properly protected from the sun and the rain. He says that the previous loan gave him the  support he needed to buy agricultural supplies, ensuring a more plentiful harvest of sweetcorn. Thus the living conditions of his family were much improved by having enough to eat.

loans.use: to buy roofing sheets and wood.

loans.name: Miramar Group

texts.es:
El comité Miramar esta conformado por 19 mujeres artesanas emprendedoras que viven en la misma comunidad. Las integrantes del comité se dedican todas a la artesanía en sus diferentes rubros como cerámicas o bordados. Ellas gracias a su talento han podido salir adelante y ayudar a sus familiares con los gastos corrientes.
Una de las integrantes la señora Rosana se dedica a la artesanía, ella se dedica a hacer bordados de encajes y de ñanduti y lo coloca en sábanas, almohadas, manteles, individuales, en ropas, etc. 
El crédito solicitado lo utilizaría para comprar los materiales que necesita como agujas, hilos, encajes, tijeras, telas, etc que le ayudarían a que su negocio crezca en clientela, ingresos y capacidad del personal.
texts.en:
The communal bank Miramar comprises nineteen enterprising craftswomen who reside in the same community. All of the members of the group work making different crafts, such as ceramics and embroidery. Their talents have allowed them to get ahead and help their families with their running expenses.

Rosana is one of its members and she is a craftswoman. She makes embroidered lace and ñanduti (a particular traditional style of embroidered lace) which she attaches to sheets, pillows, tablecloths, placemats, clothing, etc. 

She will use the requested loan to purchase the materials she needs, such as needles, thread, lace, scissors, fabric, etc. This will allow her business to reach a larger customer base, generate more income, and increase personnel capability.

loans.use: to purchase thread, needles, scissors, fabric, lace, etc.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva, a 32-year-old married mother of three, works hard to provide for her family. She has been operating a general store in the Philippines for seven years and also earns an income from raising pigs and farming vegetables.

Having borrowed and repaid six previous loans from NWTF, Eva is requesting a new one for PHP 20000 to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store. Eva aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Leticia Del Carmen

texts.es: Leticia desde Malambo dice a sus prestamistas de Kiva “Gracias por ayudar a cumplir los sueños de crecimiento de mi negocio” y esto es justamente porque le ha ido muy bien y quiere continuar creciendo en él. Con su anterior credikiva compró telas, encajes, correderas,  y en general materias primas e insumos de confección y para elaborar prendas en bisutería. Con su anterior credikiva logró cumplir con sus pedidos de uniformes y surtir mejor su miscelánea. Ahora planea con el financiamiento de Kiva,  comprar un mayor número de hilos, encajes y botones. Su inversión tendrá éxito pues está bien ubicada en pleno centro de Malambo, zona comercial del municipio, donde ella goza de una buena clientela, que la complementan  instituciones educativas y muchos clientes particulares.
texts.en: Leticia from Malambo addresses the following message to Kiva lenders: "Thank you for helping me achieve my dream of making my business grow." She is thankful for how well it is faring and wishes to continue on this course. With her previous loan, she bought cloth, lace, zips, and other supplies with which to make clothes and jewellery. She was thus able to fulfil her customers' orders for school uniforms as well as to offer a greater variety of items for sale. With this new Kiva loan, she plans to buy more thread, lace, and buttons. Her investment will pay off because her shop is very well located, in the very centre of Malambo, which is the commercial area of the town. She has many customers, both educational institutions and individual customers.

loans.use: to buy more thread, lace, and buttons.

loans.name: Carmen Ivonne

texts.es:
Carmen, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para poder continuar trabajando y que su negocio se mantenga con un buen nivel de mercadería, en esta ocasión comparara como siempre productos de primera necesidad, entre ellos se encuentra el aceite, arroz, azúcar, frijoles, carne, y otros productos no perecederos que son necesarios y demandados por los clientes.

Manifiesta que su experiencia con el préstamo anterior y ayudó a fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias ha logrado apoyar a su familia, especialmente sus padres cubriéndoles los gastos de alimentación y gastos médicos.
texts.en: Carmen has decided to get a new loan to continue working and so that her business will have a good amount of merchandise.  On this occasion she will buy basic staple items as usual.  Among them will be rice, oil, sugar, beans, meat and other non-perishable items needed that her customers demand.  She states that her experience with the previous loan was that it helped her to strengthen the business and with the profits she’s been able to support her family, especially her parents covering their food and medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Consuelo De Jesus

texts.es:
Consuelo, solicita un préstamo por la necesidad de crecer más el inventario de la perfumería, su inversión será precisamente en un lote de losiones de diferentes fragancias, este préstamo será un gran aporte para que ella pueda disponer de nueva mercadería y ofrecer a sus clientes.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo, el cual le sirvió para cancelar dos pedidos de perfumes, hasta el momento ha tenido una gran oportunidad de crecimiento en el negocio con nuevos clientes, su condición económica en la familia considera que se encuentra estable.
texts.en:
Consuelo is requesting a loan because she needs to increase her inventory of perfume. Her investment will be precisely for a lot of various perfumes.  This loan will be of great help to her so that she can have new merchandise available to offer her customers. 

Her previous loan had a positive effect in that she was able to pay for two perfume orders.  To date, she’s had a great opportunity to grow in business with new customers.  She considers her family economic condition to be stable.

loans.use: to pay for two perfume orders.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, es soltera y no tiene hijos; vive en una casa en anticrético ocupando solo dos habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Agua de la vida en la zona norte de la  ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica  a la venta de todo tipo de  CD´s  y DVD´s, ya sean musicales o de películas, pues Carmen cuenta con un puesto de venta en el centro de la ciudad y con lo que gana trabajando por más de ocho horas al día debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de CD´s y DVD´s  por cantidades mayores para mejorar sus ingresos pues desea aumentar su mercadería.
El sueño de Carmen es tener su casa propia ya que desea tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Carmen is single and has no children.  She lives in an anticrético [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] house occupying two bedrooms.  The house is located in the north part of La Paz in the Agua de la Vida neighborhood.

She earns income at present selling all types of CDs and DVDs, be they music or film because Carmen has a sales stand downtown and what she earns by working more than 8 hours per day is able to cover her food and basic utility costs.  She needs the loan to buy CDs and DVDs in large amounts to improve income because she wants to increase her merchandise.

Carmen’s dream is to own a house because she wants to have more comfort and improve her quality of life.  This is the first time she’s requested an IMPRO and KIVA loan.

loans.use: to buy CDs and DVDs at wholesale for subsequent resale at retail.

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en: Fedila, a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. NWTF is relisting Fedila 's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en: Crisanta, who  is married and has operated a food production and vending business in the Philippines for 15 years, works hard to support her family. She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her enterprise. In the future, Crisanta would like to save money to expand her business and make some house improvements.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine, who is married and has had a bread business in the Philippines for two years, works hard to support her family. She is requesting a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more bread to sell to her customers. In the future, Catherine would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Melva Albertina

texts.es:
Melva, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo debido a la importancia que tiene su negocio y que considera que través de los préstamos ha logrado mejorar su condición de vida, estos fondos prestados los invertirá en la construcción y reparación de una galera, comprándose láminas y otros materiales necesarios, lo demás lo invertirá en el negocio.

Considera que el préstamo anterior ha permitido mejorar sus condiciones económicas y la disponibilidad en el negocio,dándole lo necesario para poder cubrir sus demandas familiares.
texts.en: Melva decided to take out a new loan because of how important her business is in her life and because she says that loans have helped her improve her quality of life. The loan will go towards building and repairing an awning: she will buy roofing sheets and other necessary materials, and the remaining funds will go towards buying supplies for her business. She says that her economic situation was much improved by the previous loan, as she was able to have enough supplies in stock to make and sell more tortillas so as to earn enough to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy roofing sheets.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma, a 40-year-old married mother of seven children, five of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past nine years she has operated a tailoring business in the Philippines. Elma has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fabrics and other materials needed for her business.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: Marlene, de 40 años de edad, habitante de Teustepe municipio de Boaco, madre soltera , tiene un hijos de 11 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y joyas de plata de manera ambulante. Tiene mas de 10 años de vender de manera ambulante comenzó vendiendo ropa usada , después introdujo la venta de cosméticos y joyas de plata. Sus labores comienzan desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana cuando prepara a su hijo para el colegio luego ella alista su bolsos y lo rellena de cosméticos y joyas de plata en busca de clientes, ofrece en las escuelas a los maestros, empresas , fabricas al personal de las oficinas, amas de casa. Después llega por la tardes  a su hogar , luego de una jornada muy larga de trabajo en las calles de la ciudad. Su objetivo es darle estudio a su hijo, también comprar su propia casa. Por eso necesita vender mas productos y conseguir más clientes. Está requiriendo el crédito para comprar cosméticos y joyas de plata.
texts.en:
Marlene, 40, lives in Teustepe, Boaco Municipality.  She’s a single mother with an 11-year-old son.  She sells cosmetics and silver jewelry from place to place.  She’s been selling this way for more than ten years having started out selling used clothes and then introducing cosmetics and silver jewelry.  

Her work day starts very early in the morning when she gets her son ready for school.  Then she gets her tote bags ready filling them with cosmetics and silver jewelry to go out looking for customers.  She sells to teachers in schools, in firms, factories, office employees and housewives.  She returns home in the evening after a very long work day throughout the city streets.  Her objective is to provide schooling for her son and also to buy a house of her own but she needs to sell more products and acquire more customers.  She needs the loan to buy cosmetics and silver jewelry.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, a 50-year-old married mother of eight children, two of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 14 years she has operated a sari-sari store business in the Philippines and is now requesting a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as rice, noodles, snack foods and other grocery items.

In the future, Elena wants to expand her business and make some house improvements.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as rice, noodles, snack foods and other grocery items.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta, a 53-year-old married mother of three, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for eight years now. Having received and repaid 13 previous loans from NWTF, Julieta has requested a new one for PHP 14000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Isaura Maria

texts.es: Isaura María  de  33 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chinandega, casado con tres hijos de  13,10y 3 años de edad, tiene por actividad económica la una bloguera desde hace  19 años. El negocio  lo inicio con fondos propios, todo con el objetivo de mejorar  los ingresos de su hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos, Isaura tiene por objetivos y metas llegar a formar a sus hijos en personas profesionales el objetivo del prestamos es invertir en el negocio para mejorar sus ganancias, el negocio consisten en la venta de productos para bloguera y ferretería como: zinc, cemento, hierro, piedrín, arena, bloque, entre  otros.
texts.en:
Isaura María is  33 years old and lives in the city of Chinandega. She is married and has three children who are thirteen, ten, and three. She has been in business for nineteen years. She started her business with her own funds, intending to improve her household income and provide for her children.
Isaura's purpose and goal is for her children to be able to become professionals. The loan will be used to invest in her business in order to increase profits. Her business sells construction an hardware material, such as zinc, cement, iron, stone brick, sand, blocks, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase construction and hardware materials such as zinc, cement, iron, stone bricks, sand, cinder blocks, etc.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.es:
Oliver, es soltero y no tiene hijos vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que trabaja como empleado en una empresa privada por más de ocho horas al día ya que debe ayudar con el pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mercadería ya que en su tiempo libre vende ropa de ambos sexos (pantalones y poleras)  y de forma ambulante para tener más ingresos.
El sueño de Oliver, es mejorar sus ingresos para posteriormente independizarse y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que solicita el crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Oliver is single and has no children; he lives in his parents’ house occupying a single bedroom.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s San Pedro zone.  He earns income working as an employee in a private firm for more than 8 hours a day; he must help pay his family’s basic utility costs.  He needs the loan to buy merchandise because in his free time he sells clothes for both sexes (pants and shirts) from place to place in order to earn additional income.  Oliver’s dream is to improve his income so that he can become independent later on and improve his quality of life this way.  This is his second loan request to IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy pants and shirts for both sexes to resell at retail.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita está casada y tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos ya son independientes y solo uno  vive con ella y está en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos ya que se dedica a la venta de fruta trabajando por más de ocho horas al día en la calle ya que no cuenta con un puesto de venta fijo, también percibe ingresos ya que su esposo trabaja como albañil y los dos aportan para la alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo solicita para la construcción de dos habitaciones más en su vivienda ya que desean tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Con un préstamo anterior concedido también a través de Kiva, pudo mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ahora puede incluso mejorarla más.
El sueño de Margarita es aumentar su capital de operaciones y mejorar sus ingresos.
Es la décimo séptima vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Margarita’s married and has three children two of which are already independent; only one still lives with her and is school age.  They live in her own three-room house located in the city of La Paz’s Tacagua zone.

She earns income at present working as a street fruit vendor for more than 8 hours daily; she does not have a permanent sales stand.  She also gets income from her husband who works in construction.  They both contribute towards food, school and basic utility costs for the family.

She requests the loan to build two rooms at home because she wants to have more comfort and improve her quality of life.  She used previous loan granted through Kiva to improve her living condition and now she can improve it still more.  Margarita’s dream is to increase working capital and improve income.  This is her 17th loan request to IMPRO and second to KIVA.

loans.use: to build two bedrooms at home.

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para mejorar la disponibilidad del negocio de mariscos y semilla de marañón, comprandose pescado fresco, camarones, conchas, y la otra parte en la compra de semilla de marañón cruda, con este nuevo préstamo le dará la disponibilidad y la posibilidad de generar mejores ingresos.

Con el préstamo anterior mejoró el inventario y hasta el momento se ha mantenido estable con sus ventas, ha tenido buenas ganancias que le han servido para ayudar a solventar todas sus necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
María’s asking for a new loan to increase availability of seafood and cashew nuts.  She will buy fresh fish, shrimp, clams and raw cashew nuts.  With this new loan she will have stock on hand and be able to generate higher income.

She used the previous loan to improve her inventory and to date has maintained stable sales.  She’s had good profits that have been useful for her to cover all her family needs.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish, shrimp, clams and cashews.

loans.name: Revelacion En Dios Group

texts.es: El Banco comunal Revelación En Dios está conformado por ocho emprendedoras que se unieron y formaron este grupo, todas han demostrados ser responsables y trabajadoras con ganas de superación personal, son personas muy humilde a las que les cuesta ganarse el sustento día a días, cada una de ellas se levanta muy tempranos para poder ofrecer sus diferentes productos a sus clientes fijos y eventuales, ya han tenido crédito con  Fundación León 2000  y durante el crédito ha demostrado ser personas responsable y con deseos de superación, tiene objetivos y metas en la vida para crecer en su negocios. En el caso de María ella vende cuajada en su casa y de forma ambulantes en su  localidad con clientes el financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo y  como es  la compra de cuajada, agradece a fundación y el programa kiva por el apoyo que le brinda a los pequeños comerciantes para trabajara dignamente.
texts.en:
The “Revelación de Dios” (God’s Revelation) communal bank has 8 entrepreneurs who joined together to form this group.  They have all shown themselves to be responsible, hardworking with strong drives to improve personally.  They are very humble people who struggle to earn their sustenance day to day.  Each one of them rises very early to offer various products to their regular and occasional customers.  They have had credit with Fundación León 2000 before and they were responsible and had the desire for self-improvement.  They have goals and objectives in life to make their businesses grow.

In María's case, she sells curd to customers at home and from place to place in her community.  She needs the loan to invest in working capital which is to buy curd.  She thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the support they give small merchants so that they can work with dignity.

loans.use: comprar:

loans.name: Claudia Veronica

texts.es:
Claudia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, ya que considera necesario poder aumentar la variedad de productos nuevos en ropa y calzado, comprándose blusas, faldas, ropa interior, en calzado se comprara una variedad para damas y caballeros, esta inversión le permitirá a Claudia continuar trabajando de la mejor manera en el mercado.

Manifiesta que su capacidad en el negocio ha mejorado, por medio de la buena inversión realizada con el préstamo anterior, ha logrado tener un buen nivel de existencia en el inventario, está satisfecha con este negocio y con la ayuda financiera que se le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Claudia is requesting another loan, as she considers it necessary to be able to increase the variety of new clothing and footwear products by buying blouses, skirts, underwear, and a variety of footwear for men and women. This investment will permit Claudia to continue working at her best in the market.

Claudia shows that her business abilities have improved: through the good investment she made with the previous loan, she has managed to keep a good level of inventory in stock. She is satisfied with this business, and with the financial help that she has been offered.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts, underwear, and a variety of footwear.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Julienne est une femme de 34 ans fiancée mère d'un enfant de 9 ans qui va déjà l'école, elle a aussi trois autres personnes à sa charge. Elle est couturière et a ouvert un atelier de couture depuis 10 ans déjà dans lequel elle fait la confection des tenus scolaires dans un quartier de la capitale. son activté rapporte plus pendant les rentrées scolaires parce que la tenue est un vêtement important pour les élèves. C'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce crédit pour s'acheter un rouleau de tissus et le matériel de couture pour la confection des tenues. ceci augmentera sa production, et donc ses ventes ainsi que ses bénéfices. Elle économisera une partie des bénéfices générés par ce crédit dans son activité pour augmenter le matériel et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Julienne, age 34, is engaged and the mother of a 9-year-old child who goes to school. She also supports three other people. She is a seamstress who has been working out of her own shop for ten years. She makes school uniforms in a district of the capital. This activity if more profitable when the children go back to school as the uniform is a key item for school kids. For this reason, Julienne is seeking a loan to buy a bolt of fabric and the sewing notions needed to make the uniforms. This will help to boost her production, which in turn will bolster her sales and profits. Part of her profits will be used to stock up on supplies for her activity, while the remainder will help to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a bolt of fabric and sewing notions.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo,con la intención de continuar mejorando la disponibilidad en el negocio de los lácteos, comprándose crema, queso fresco, queso seco, cuajada, y otros productos derivados de la leche, éste le permitirá mejorar su disponibilidad a los clientes y poder realizar un buen número de ventas.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo, debido a la buena inversión que ha realizado en el negocio, los ingresos han sido mejor para cubrir la demanda de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sonia has decided to seek a new loan so she can continue improving her milk products business by buying cream, fresh and dried cheeses, cuajada [custard], and other milk products.  This will allow her to provide better service to her customers and attain a good level of sales. 

With her prior loan, Sonia was able to make a positive impact because she invested well in the business, and she's had more income to meet the demands of her household.

loans.use: to buy cream, fresh cheese, dried cheese, and cuajada [custard].

loans.name: Rosa Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Rosa Poty esta conformado por 12 integrantes mujeres que se dedican a actividades varias. Algunas se dedican a la venta de mercaderías como ropas, bordados, lencerías otras están en camino a emprender  y otras son niñeras. El comité se caracteriza por ser muy responsable en los plazos de pagos, también se rescata la unidad y solidaridad entre sus integrantes.
Una integrante del comité la señora Maria se dedica a la venta de bebidas tanto gasificadas como alcohólicas. Con esta actividad ella aporta su grano de arena a la economía de su hogar. 
El crédito sería utilizado para comprar mayor cantidad de mercaderías para así volver a venderlas.
texts.en:
The “Rosa Poty” committee has 12 members, all women who carry out a variety of activities.  Some sells merchandise like clothes, embroidery and lingerie and others are on the way to becoming entrepreneurs and some are babysitters.  The committee is noted for being very responsible with respect to their payments.  One also notices the unity and solidarity that exists among them.

One of the members is María who sells both carbonated and alcoholic beverages.  She’s able through this activity to contribute a little grain of salt to her home’s economy.  She will use the loan to buy larger amounts of merchandise to resell.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and alcoholic beverages.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Emilio y su esposa son padres de familia y tiene tres hijos de edad escolar. Están solicitando un préstamo para poder pagar los gastos escolares que son la compra de los uniformes y útiles (cuadernos, lápiz, plumas, colores, carpetas y mochilas), no cuentan con el dinero necesario para poder cubrir esta necesidad escolar de sus hijos. 
El señor Emilio trabaja para una maquiladora como chofer de un camión de personal y su esposa de dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales (comida típica mexicana), estos son los ingreso que tiene para los gastos familiares. 
Desean que sus hijos tengan la educación y los estudios necesarios para que puedan ser unos triunfadores en la vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Emilio and his wife are the parents of three school-age children. They are requesting a loan so that they can pay for school expenses. Emilio and his family must buy uniforms and supplies (notebooks, pencils, pens, crayons, folders, and backpacks). He and his wife do not have the necessary funds to cover the school needs of their children.

Sr. Emilio works at a factory as a staff truck driver. His wife prepares and sells tamales (a traditional Mexican dish). These sources of income are designated to help with the family expenses. Emilio and his wife want their children to have an education and the necessary studies that will enable them to triumph in life.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school expenses.

loans.name: Josue Abinadab

texts.es:
Josué, solicita un nuevo préstamo para continuar trabajando en una siembra de maíz, se comprará ocho sacos de abono y una bolsa de herbicidas, estos materiales le permiten prevenir el cultivo de las plagas y de la maleza, aumentando su capacidad de producción, él espera que esta nueva inversión sea provechosa para el bien de su familia.

Manifiesta que el préstamo anterior le permitió aumentar la producción de granos básicos, a través de la aplicación de los materiales, hasta el momento considera que su condición se mantiene estable gracias a los préstamos financiados por kiva.
texts.en:
Josué is requesting a new loan so he can continue work on his corn crop. He will buy eight sacks of compost and one bag of herbicides. These materials permit him to prevent the development of infestations and weeds, increasing his production capacity. He hopes that this new investment will benefit his family's well-being. 

Josué expresses that the previous loan allowed him to increase the production of staple crops through the application of the materials. At the moment, he feels that his living conditions are stable, thanks to the Kiva-financed loans.

loans.use: to purchase eight sacks of compost and one bag of herbicide.

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es: La señora  María, de 57 años de edad, habita en la comarca llamada Las Canoas, Teustepe, solo finalizo su primaria, es casada, es madre de 4 hijos, todos mayores de edad. Se dedica a la venta de ropa desde  hace 10 años negocio que inicio con créditos que sacaba en otras instituciones le ayudaron a mejorar su vida familiar y a mantener su negocio.  Hoy siempre lo realiza sola ya que todos sus hijos están casados, ella vende  casa a casa o ambulante en otros pueblos cercanos a la comunidad. María hoy solicita este crédito para comprar  ropa para surtir el negocio y dice que este nuevo crédito le ayudara ya que al surtir mas la venta venderá mas. Su meta es lograr tener su negocio llenos de mercadería variada y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: María is 57 years old. She lives in a town called  Las Canoas, Teustepe. She only finished elementary school. She is married and the mother of 4 children, all of them grown. She has sold clothes for 10 years. She started the business with loans she would take out from other institutions. They helped her improve her family live and maintain her business. Today she does it alone since all of her children are married. She sells door to door or as a street vendor in other toens near her community. Today María is asking for this loan to buy clothes to stock her business. This new loan will help her because with more stock to sell, she will sell more. Her goal is to have her business full of different merchandise and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread for weaving.

loans.name: Makarimal Akhlakh Groupe 2

texts.fr:
Le groupement d’intérêt  économique  dénommé GIE MAKARIMAL AKHLAkH est né le 10 octobre 2003 au Sénégal. Le terme   Makarimal Akhlakh symbolise une personne qui a un bon cœur,  de bonnes pratiques. Le GIE  a atteint le nombre de 300 adhérents depuis  2009. Son objectif est d’unir ses membres et de leur permettre d’exercer des activités de production agricole et halieutique, de commerce général d’import export et de transport, d’industrie, d’artisanat, de bâtiments , d’élevage, d’exploitation minière, de pêche, d’exploitation d’hydrocarbures, d’art  et de culture, d’imprimerie et de menuiserie bois, de services et d’action d’utilité publique, de représentation, de transformation de produits halieutiques, d’agriculture , de vente de pièces détachées, de fabrique de glace , de boulangerie et de prestations de services divers. Le GIE vise aussi a consolider des liens d’amitié et de solidarité entre ses membres pour leur permettre d’acquérir des moyens matériels et financiers nécessaires au développement de leurs activités génératrices de revenus et de bénéficier de tous les avantages liés au GIE. Et c’est dans cette mouvance qu’un protocole d’accord a été signé entre le GIE et UIMCEC  au bénéfice  des membres du GIE au niveau national. La première phase  a porté sur  un échantillon de 120 membres actifs divisés en 12 groupes de 10.
Makarimal Akhlakh groupe 2 regroupe 10 membres du GIE Makarimal Akhlakh qui habitent le meme quartier. Ils sont représentés par madame Henriette qui a levé la main sur la photo  de groupe. Elle est mariée et évolue depuis 20 ans dans le secteur du commerce. Elle pratique la vente de  pagnes et d’encens. Les revenus que lui procure son activité lui permettent de participer à la dépense quotidienne. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit dans le but de se procurer les produits qu’elle commercialise en plus grande quantité et développer davantage son activité.
