Sabeen's husband does not have enough income to fulfill the basic needs of his family; therefore, by stitching clothes, Sabeen helps her husband to meet their family's needs and her children's education expenses. But in the past month, her sewing machine had stopped working, which means she is not able to continue her tailoring business. 

Sabeen has good beautician skills as well and her dream is to open her own beauty salon in the future. 
  
Sabeen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for purchasing a new sewing machine and sewing materials, such as thread, needles, buttons, scissors, cloth etc. She is hopeful that with the help of requested loan amount, she will be able to continue her business and increase their monthly income as well.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine and sewing materials, such as thread, needles, buttons, scissors, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Ma.rosemarie

texts.en:
Ma.Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving. She has been in this business for seven years.

In the future, Ma.Rosemarie would like to save money to expand her business and do some house improvements.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving.

loans.name: Sherlene

texts.en: Sherlene lives in Lubia, Pagadian City. She has been earning a living by providing transportation services for three years. She earns an income of 8,000 PHP a month for this business. Sherlene has requested a loan in the amount of 35,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit, to repair her transport vehicle used in her business. She joined GDMPC in 2011. Her plan in the future is to hopefully improve her business.

loans.use: to repair her transport vehicle used in her business.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Claudia y su esposo constantemente le están realizando mejoras a su vivienda, les esta haciendo falta un cuarto mas pero le esta haciendo falta material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. Solicita el préstamo para iniciar la construcción de una recamara en la planta alta de su casa.
La señora Claudia se dedica a la venta de artículos de uso personal por catálogos y su esposo es técnico plomero para la unidad de medicina familiar de la ciudad, son los ingresos que tiene para los gastos familiares, pero el ingreso del negocio de la señora Claudia será para pagar el crédito.
Desean que sus hijos tengan mayor comodidad y espacio en su casa y que el patrimonio esta en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Claudia and her husband are constantly making improvements to their home. They need another room, but they need materials and to pay for the person who will do the work. They are requesting the loan to begin the construction of a bedroom on the upper floor of their house.

Claudia earns her living selling personal care products from catalogs, and her husband is a plumbing technician for the family medicine unit of the city. They will have his income for household costs, but the income from Claudia's business will be for paying back the loan. 

They want their children to have greater comfort and space in their house, and for their children's inheritance [the house] to be in better condition.

loans.use: to construct a room on the upper floor of her house.

loans.name: La Amistad De Ollantaytambo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LA AMISTAD DE OLLANTAYTAMBO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Romania ella es casada y tiene 49 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de venta de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y comidas, la socia prepara paltos típicos de Urubamba como cuy al horno, pollo al horno y sopas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio de restaurant, en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta salir a pasear a su hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local más amplio para su restaurant.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como zanahorias, verduras, carne y pollo.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto, porque pidieron permiso por motivos de salud.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de venta de frutas, negocio de venta de verduras y negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These group members belong to the community bank "La Amistad de Ollantaytambo". This bank is located in the Ollantaytambo district within the province and region of Cusco.

One of the group members is Romania. She is 49 years old and is married with two children. She works in her restaurant business preparing breakfast, lunch, and other food. Many of her dishes are typical to the Urubamba region, including baked guinea pig, baked chicken, and soups. She has been working in this restaurant for 8 years and works from 8am to 5pm.

In her free time, Romania likes to take walks with her children. Her dream is to have a larger space for her restaurant.

Romania is requesting this loan in order to purchase cooking ingredients such as carrots, vegetables, meat, and chicken.

Some group members attached their photos to the group photo after it was taken because they were unable to be present for the group photo due to health reasons. Other members of the group make their living selling handicrafts, fruits, vegetables, and groceries.

Romania is grateful for those who contribute to her dream through this loan and she is committed to paying off the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients such as carrots, vegetables, meat, and chicken.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 44 years old and is married, with two children who are in school.

Juliet is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs. Juliet has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Juliet would like to save enough to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs that she is raising.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a basket weaving business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her business. NWTF is relisting Emma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her basket weaving business.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en: This time, for her third cycle loan, Gertrudes is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase more grocery products for resale. The mango sales business and hog raising business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues and provides for Gertrudes and her family, with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products for resale.

loans.name: Anicet

texts.en:
Anicet is 49 years old and is married, with five children between the ages of four and 16. He sells various goods, such as beans, rice, sugar, pens, etc., from a store, which operates from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day except Sunday. 

Anicet has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to purchase various goods such as beans, rice, sugar, pens, potatoes, etc. for resale. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, pens, potatoes, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food market business in the Philippines. Vicenta requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy vegetables, seasonings and other ingredients. Vicenta has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from a repair shop.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, seasonings and other ingredients .

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Teodora y su esposo han estado mejorando su vivienda realizándole algunas mejoras. Están solicitando un préstamo para terminar la construcción de dos baños y los acabados de la cocina, ya que necesitan comprar material y no cuentan con el dinero necesario, quien se encargara de terminar la mejora es su esposo en horarios adicional a su trabajo.
La señora Teodora trabaja  como cocinera de una escuela del gobierno y su esposo trabaja en la limpieza de la escuela y también realiza trabajos de construcción a personas particulares, los ingresos de su esposo serán para los gastos familiares, el que ella genera en su trabajo será para el pago del crédito.
Desea terminar las construcción de su casa y que su patrimonio este en mejores condiciones y segura.
texts.en:
Teodora and her husband have been remodeling their home by making several improvements. They are requesting a loan in order to finish building two bathrooms and for the finishing in the kitchen, because they need to purchase materials and they don't have enough money. Her husband will work around his work schedule to finish the improvements.

Teodora works as a cook in a public school, and her husband works as a janitor at the school and also does construction jobs for private individuals. Her husband's income will be for family expenses, and the income she gets from her job will go towards paying off the loan.

She wants to finish building her home so that they can live under better and safer conditions.

loans.use: to build two bathrooms and finish the kitchen.

loans.name: Rhenalyn

texts.en:
Rhenalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy vegetables, meat, rice and other ingredients for her food business. Rhenalyn has been in this business for four years. She also earns other income from clothing sales.

Rhenalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to buy a vehicle for her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, rice and other ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en: Leonia is a 57-year-old married woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, ufi and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Leonia has requested a loan to buy new equipment for the business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. With her profits, Leonia hopes to improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, a grass-sprayer, and chemicals for her farm.

loans.name: Silaumea

texts.en: Silaumea is a 40-year-old married woman with five children. She would like to start growing taro, taamu, and bananas to earn a living. Silaumea has requested a loan to start her new business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Silaumea will spend her profits to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy weed killer, seeds, a shovel, gloves and bush knives for her farming business.

loans.name: Joy Ann

texts.en: Joy Ann is from Balide, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 31 years old. Joy Ann is married and has two children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store. Joy Ann has been engaged in her business for six years and earns PHP 8,000 a month. In 2008, Joy Ann joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of PHP 11,000, which will be used to purchase new items for resale, such as candies, milo, shampoo, soap, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items for resale, such as candies, milo, shampoo and soap.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 46 years old, married and has three children. Milka owns and operates a specialized retail store. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns PHP 5,000 a month from it. In 2008, she joined GDMPC. 

Milka is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase large quantities of local drinks for resale.

loans.name: Mehrojiddinkhon

texts.ru: Мехрочиддинхон житель города Душанбе. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Мехрочиддинхон арендует небольшой цех. Он занимается выпечкой (производством) хлеба, булочек, кульчи и кондитерских изделий. В этой области он работает уже два года. Мехрочиддинхон просит кредит для покупки сахара.
texts.en:
Mehrojiddinkhon lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 38 years old and married with four children.
Mehrojiddinkhon rents a small bakery, where he bakes bread, sweet buns, kulchas (Tajik flatbread), and pastries. He's been working in this area for two years. Mehrojiddinkhon has requested a loan to buy sugar.

loans.use: to buy sugar

loans.name: Taufau

texts.en: Taufau is a 57-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, and ufi to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Taufau has requested a loan to improve and expand her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Taufau hopes to improve the business to help her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy gloves, bush knives, weed killer, and seeds for her farm.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is married and has three children. She is 41 years old and resides in Balugo, Tambulig. Zenaida owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice to earn a living. She's been in this business for 10 years. Each month she earns 6,000. 

She has requested a loan of 8,000 to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. In 2009, Zenaida joined GDMPC. In the future, Zenaida wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 48-year-old hard-working housewife living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her two sons and and two daughters. Her family is very poor and is facing many financial problems. For the past 15 years, her husband, who is the only wage earner in her family, has been working as a carpenter. He wants to purchase a new wood cutting machine so he can work more efficiently in future. 

Shamim has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband in purchasing a wood cutting machine. She is very hopeful that the loan will bring a positive change to her husband's income.

loans.use: To purchase a  wood cutting machine for her husband.

loans.name: Rosa Claribel

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su esposo es albañil, tienen tres hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración de pan artesanal para la venta, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia y realiza por ejemplo quesadías, dobladas, estos son los nombres que reciben algunos de los productos que ella elabora, también realiza ventas de comida, para poder generar una mejor condición económica a su hogar.

Solicita  un préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de harina, levadura, huevos, azúcar, esto le ayudará a aumentar la disponibilidad en el inventario y poder mejorar el negocio.

Su aspiración es crecer con el negocio, mejorando la capacidad de producción, a futuro tiene el objetivo de comprarse un vehículo para poder distribuir a distintas zonas los productos.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband, who is a bricklayer. They have three children. She earns a living making homemade bread to sell. She started this business of her own initiative and makes, for example, "quesadías" and "dobladas" (these are the names that have been given to some of the products she makes). She also sells meals, to be able generate a better economic condition in her home.

She is requesting a loan to be able to invest in the purchase of flour, yeast, eggs, and sugar. This will help her to increase the availability of her inventory and to improve the business.

Her aspiration is to grow her business, improving production capacity. In the future, she has the objective of buying herself a vehicle so she can distribute her products to different areas.

loans.use: to purchase flour, yeast, eggs, and sugar.

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en: Elisapeta is a 38-year-old married woman with two children. She would like to start growing ufi, taro and bananas to earn a living. Elisapeta has requested a loan to purchase new equipment to start her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Elisapeta will spend her profits to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, weed killer, sprayer and a shovel for her farming business.

loans.name: Tafa

texts.en: Tafa is a 55-year-old married woman with six children. She has a small farm and grows taro, taamu, etc., to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Tafa has requested a loan to help with her children's education and also to improve her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Tafa hopes to expand her business and save more money.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knives, gloves and a bush cutter for her farming business.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
Jose, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su esposa, tienen dos hijos, su trabajo lo aprendió a través de su padre cuando era joven, tiene 15 años de estar realizando para su propia familia, sus hijos le ayudan a realizar sus actividades y también paga mosos.

Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como lo es el abono, herbicidas, que le permite  proteger la siembra de la maleza y de las plagas, el préstamo le dara el dinero suficiente para invertir en el cultivo y poder obtener una buena cosecha.

Su objetivo futuro es tener mejor capacidad en el negocio sembrando maíz, y ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Jose works growing corn. He is fifty years old and lives with his wife. They have two children. He learned how to work from his father when he was young and has been working for his own family for fifteen years. His children help him with his work and he also hires laborers.

He is requesting a loan to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizer and herbicides, which allow him to protect his crops from weeds and pests. The loan will provide him with enough money to invest in his crops and obtain a good harvest.

His goals for the future are for his corn-growing business to achieve higher capability and to offer his children better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Francisco Luis

texts.es:
Francisco, vive con su familia, tiene dos hijos pero no viven con él, él se dedica a la agricultura sembrando maíz, esto lo inicio por su propia cuenta, no tiene un horario establecido para realizar las labores en el campo y cuenta ya con bastante experiencia en su trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como lo son el abono, pesticidas e insecticidas, esta compra le permitirá a Francisco poder tener un cultivo con los cuidados necesarios para prevenirle las plagas y también prevenir la maleza, con el objetivo de que sea más productivo.

Su proyeccion es a futuro generar una buena cosecha, teniendo la clientela  a quienes poder distribuirles dicha cosecha, y que esto le permitirá generar ingresos para las diferentes necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
Francisco lives with his family. He has two children, but they don't live with him. He earns his living in agriculture, growing corn. He is self-employed; he doesn't have a fixed schedule for doing his work in the fields and he already has a lot of experience in his work.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies like fertilizer, pesticides, and insecticides. This purchase will allow Francisco to be able to have a crop with the necessary measures taken to prevent infestations and also to prevent weeds, with the objective of the crop being more productive.

His plan for the future is to generate a good harvest, having customers to whom he can distribute that harvest; this will allow him to generate income for different household needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a atender un negocio de productos de primera necesidad, tiene dos hijos y vive con su esposo, el negocio lo instaló con el objetivo de generar el sustento para su familia apoyando siempre a su pareja, hasta el momento ha tenido buenos resultados.

Solicita un préstamo para poder abastecer el negocio de mercadería por ejemplo aceite, embutidos, papel higiénico, pastas, productos de aseo personal, esto le brindará una mayor diversidad de productos y aumentar el inventario de la tienda, ya que también así estará atrayendo la atención de más clientes.

Su objetivo es lograr las mejoras necesarias en el negocio, para que éste sea más rentable, que le pueda proveer a su familia un mejor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Ana is in charge of a business selling essential goods. She has two children and lives with her husband. She set up the business with the intention of providing for her family and always helping her husband. So far she has seen positive results.

She is requesting a loan in order to stock her business with merchandise, such as oil, cold cuts, toilet paper, pasta, and personal hygiene products. This will provide her store with a wider variety of products and will increase inventory as well as draw the attention of more customers.

Her goal is to make all necessary improvements to her business, so that it becomes more profitable and provides her family with a larger profit margin.

loans.use: to purchase oil, cold cuts, toilet paper, pasta, and personal hygiene products.

loans.name: Mwanawani

texts.en:
Mwanawani, 41 years old, is married and she works hard to provide for her family. For over 10 years, she has been operating a clothes selling business, selling door to door. She dreams of opening a kiosk in future. Mwanawani sells a variety of clothes ranging from women's clothes to men's and children's clothes.

Mwanawani has requested a KES 10,000 loan through Yehu to buy more bales of clothes to sell. She has previously borrowed and repaid 3 loans from Yehu. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Ms. Shabana is 28 years old, a vigorous lady who has been doing a business of stitching for 4 years.  She is happily doing it to support her family.   She knows the stitching techniques very well and is famous in her town. She is in charge of proving her family with bread and butter. She has improved her business gradually with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she has two children and her husband makes his living as a daily wage earner. There were days when he could not find work and had to return home without any money. He was not even able to provide a meal to his family.  Shabana contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor, to help them to fight poverty. With the support of Kashf, she bought a sewing machine and started her work. 

She stitches on her own and sells the garments and also stitches on the request of clients. She has a good client list, and now she has requested a repeat loan of Rs.20,000/- to buy raw materials such as good quality cloth and thread of different colors for stitching more clothes to increase her sales. She hopes to earn profit and will utilize it on her children’s living and betterment.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as good quality cloth and thread of different colors for stitching more clothes

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 50 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 11 and 22 years old. His business is well organized and he sells beans, and potatoes. He employs one person to help him and starts from 6am, working until 6pm every day with one year of experience.

Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance company in order to buy more potatoes, beans, rice, and bananas. With the extra profit from this loan, Emmanuel will pay his children's school fees and to save for his future.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, beans, rice, and bananas to expand his restaurant.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, se dedica a la venta de atol y pupusas en su vehículo, es una persona de principios religiosos, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, el negocio tiene cinco años de existir lo realiza por las tardes su esposa prepara los productos él los distribuye en diferentes zonas.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales para el negocio por ejemplo invertirá en azúcar, canela, maíz, harina, aceite, condimentos, tomates, entre otros productos que son necesarios para la elaboración de su venta, el crédito le dara la disponibilidad económica que pueda necesitar para hacer una buena compra y generar una mejor condición en el negocio.

Las metas de Carlos son crecer en el negocio, ampliarlo en productos para ofrecer a los clientes, ya que tiene la disposición y el entusiasmo por mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Carlos makes a living selling "atol" [a dessert made of ground corn, cinnamon and milk] and "pupusas" from his vehicle. Carlos is a person of religious principles. He lives with his wife and three children. His business has been in existence for five years. He works in the afternoons and his wife prepares the foods that Carlos distributes in different areas. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of ingredients for his business; for example, he will invest in sugar, cinnamon, corn, flour, oil, seasonings, and tomatoes, among other products that are necessary to carry out his sales. The loan will give him the available funds he will need to make a good purchase and generate better conditions in his business. Carlos's goals are to grow his business, increasing the variety of products he offers to his customers, because he has the disposition and the enthusiasm to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cinnamon, corn, flour, oil, seasonings, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is 55 years old and married. She is from Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She has two grown children who have helped her in taking care of their bananas. They have been raising bananas for 3 years and earn 6,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Justina joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer, and pay for weeding. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for weeding.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene is 32 years old and is married with two children, 2 and 4 years old. His business is well organized and he sells various goods such as clothes, juice, biscuits etc.

Eugene has requested a loan from Kiva lenders through Vision Finance company in order to buy various goods such as clothes, juice, biscuits, etc. for resale. With the profit from this loan, he will be able to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as clothes, juice, biscuits, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Silivale

texts.en: Silivale is a 42-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, banana etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Silivale has requested a loan to buy new equipment for her business and to improve her home. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Silivale hopes to expand her business and save more to improve her family and supplement her income.

loans.use: to buy new equipment for her business

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Inés es una mujer trabajadora, que le encanta cada día salir adelante por su familia y es una persona humilde y sencilla. Inés vive con sus tres hijas en la ciudad de Ibarra.

Inés trabaja en la compra venta de muebles de madera como sillas y mesas, también se dedica a la venta de almoadas para cama, este negocio ayuda a Inés a obtener ingresos económicos que son vitales para su familia, actualmente ha solicitado un crédito a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser utilizado en la compra de de mercadería como mesas de madera y almoadas para bebes; inversión que incrementará sus productos, ventas e ingresos.

Inés sueña en tener un local para poder ofrecer sus productos ya que actualmente está en un puesto del mercado.
texts.en: Inés is a hard-working woman, who loves to pull ahead every day for her family. She is a humble and simple person. Inés lives with her three daughters in the city of Ibarra. Inés works selling and buying wooden furniture, such as chairs and tables. She also sells pillows. This income helps Inés get the financial income that is vital to support her family. She has currently requested a loan to Fodemi that she will use to buy merchandise like wooden tables and baby pillows. The investment will increase her stock, sales and income. Inés dreams of having a store to be able to offer her products, since she currently has a stand in the market.

loans.use: to buy products such as wooden tables and baby pillows

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María, está motivada realizando sus ventas en el negocio, solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales que le permiten mantener la producción, como la compra de maíz, yuca, azúcar, papaya, mango, sandia, entre otros que son necesarios para que ella permanezca en el negocio, hoy dia ofrece fruta fresca.

Su objetivo es aprovechar esta ayuda para el negocio, ya que representa un ingreso para su familia, con su experiencia en el crédito anterior tuvo una mayor posibilidad de variar los productos.
texts.en: María is motivated by her business’ sales.  She’s asking for a loan to buy materials to maintain production.  She will buy corn, manioc, sugar, papayas, mangoes and watermelons, among others that are necessary for her to stay in business.  She sells fresh fruit.  Her objective is to avail herself of this help for the business.  Her prior loan experience was that she was able to offer greater product variety.

loans.use: to buy corn, manioc, sugar, papaya, mango and watermelon.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is married with four children. She is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. To earn a living, Gina operates a business which provides transportation services to local community members. She's been doing this for two years, and every month she earns 8,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Gina joined GDMPC in 2007. In the future, Gina hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expand his bicycle transportation business by buying another bicycle.

loans.name: Joseph Fabricio

texts.es:
Joseph Fabricio tiene 24 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con el hijo. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz..

Joseph Fabricio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, además se dedica a la crianza de pollos y patos. Las compras y las ventas las realiza en ventanas cada 15 días.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, urea, insecticidas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito podrá trabajar libremente con el propio capital. El sueño es tener un negocio propio y salir adelante con los hijos y la esposa.

En el tiempo lire le gusta salir a pasear por el campo con la familia.
texts.en:
Joseph Fabricio, 24, is married living with his wife and son in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  This communal bank is called “San Francisco de Sibimbe” and it’s located in Recinto Sibimbe belonging to Ventanas Canton.  It has 20 members who work in short cycle corn and rice farming.

Joseph Fabricio grows corn, rice and soya and also raises chickens and ducks.  His purchases and his sales take place every two weeks in Ventanas.  
He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, insecticide, fertilizer and manure.  With support from the loan he will be able to work freely with capital of his own.  His dream is to have a business of his own and to get ahead with his wife and children.  In his free time he likes going out into the countryside with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Pedro Leonel

texts.es:
Pedro Leonel tiene 22 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con el hijo Adriam de un año. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, urea, líquido para la maleza y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como la falta de dinero para invertir. El sueño es tener un negocio propio y un terreno para construir una casa.

En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Pedro Leonel, 22, is married living with his wife and son, Adriam, 1, in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  This communal bank is called “San Francisco de Sibimbe” and it’s located in Recinto Sibimbe belonging to Ventanas Canton.  It has 20 members who work in short cycle corn and rice farming.

Pedro grows corn and rice.  His purchases take place in Ventanas and his sales in the local market there.  He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, weed killer, fertilizer and manure.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  He faces challenges like not having money to invest.  His dream is to have a business of his own and a lot to build a house on.  In his free time he likes playing Indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres de Fe tiene 12 integrantes,todas ellas mamás muy responsables y trabajadoras que se esmeran por tener un futuro mejor para ellas y sus respectivas familias.
La sra. Angela, una de las integrantes del grupo, se dedica a la venta de insumos de salud, medicamentos y materiales que hacen efectivos la salud de su clientela y que le genera ayuda económica como para poder mantener a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos varios para llenar su stock como jeringas, agujas, tapabocas, pastillas, jarabes, etc.
texts.en: The Mujeres de Fe committee has 12 members. All of them are responsible, working mothers who work hard to have a better future for them and for their families. Angela, one of the members of the group, sells health supplies for a living: medicine and supplies that improve the health of her customers and that generate the income she needs to be able to support her family. She requests the loan to buy a variety of supplies to fill up her stock, such as, syringes, needles, surgical masks, pills, syrup, etc.

loans.use: to buy medical supplies such as pills, syrup, syringes, surgical masks, etc

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Ms. Shamim is a 51-year-old married woman who enjoys her work of hand embroidery. She started doing work with her daughters four years ago. Her embroidery of wedding dresses is very popular in her community. Due to increasing demand for her embroidery designs, Shamim now needs to employ other women in her business.

Shamim has four daughters and two sons. Her husband is not in good enough physical shape to support her family. Shamim is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life, including food, clothes, and education. 

Shamim has requested a loan of 30000 PKR from Kashf foundation. In this way she can manage to buy more frames, needles, beats, and threads of different colors, which will help her meet demand consistently.  She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and will make use of the resulting profits for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: To buy more frames, needles, beats, and threads of different colors which will help her meet demand consistently.

loans.name: Parvin

texts.en:
Parvin is 29 years old. He is a single person and has no children. Parvin was an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Fuzuli town, but now he has settled in Fuzuli region with his old brother. 

Parvin has been manufacturing iron doors and lattice for seven years.  He needs 1,500 AZN to buy instruments for his work. 

He loves his work. He learned his business from his father.

loans.use: to buy instruments for metal-working.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is from La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 48 years old, separated, and has two children. 

To make a living, Oscar owns and operates a retail business.  He has been in the business for two years and earrns PHP 6,000 a month.
In 2009, Oscar joined Kiva partner, GDMPC. 

Oscar is requesting a loan of  PHP 10,000 that will be used to purchase additional products, like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. 

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school costs.

loans.name: Sara Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer muy carismática, se destaca por ser trabajadora, feliz, responsable y lo más importante es que es una comerciante emprendedora. Sara vive con sus tres hijos en la ciudad de Ibarra.

Sara trabaja sola en el comercio de ropa interior para adultos y niños, este negocio lo tiene ya 17 años en un puesto del mercado y continuamente a tenido necesidades de incrementar sus ventas para obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida, actualmente realiza un crédito a Fodemi el mismo que va a invertir en la compra de medias para niño y adulto, ropa interior femenina, ropa interiro masculina.

Sara sueña en tener un local propio y más grande para tener mayor variedad de productos y así obtener mejores ingresos y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sara is a very charismatic woman who stands out for being very hardworking, happy and responsible; what’s most important is that she’s an enterprising merchant.  She lives with her three children in the city of Ibarra.

Sara works alone selling underwear for children and adults.   She’s been in business 17 years in a stand in the market and she’s always needed to increase sales to earn higher income and improve her quality of life.  She’s currently taking out a Fodemi loan to buy socks for children and adults and underwear for men and women.  Sara dreams with having her own, larger locale in order to have more variety of products and to earn higher income to be able to improve her children’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy socks for children and adults and women's and men's underwear.

loans.name: Freddy Jose

texts.es: Freddy originario de Granada, tiene 9 hijos ya mayores de edad todos ellos, el se dedica a transportar objetos, conocida esta actividad como acarreo practica esto desde hace 24 años. El inicio esta actividad ya que su papa se dedicaba a lo mismo y fue el quien le heredo el carretón con el caballo cuando tenia 23 años siendo esto su medio de generar ingresos, primeramente sus hijos le ayudaban ahora que ellos son casados el lo hace solo comercializando por toda la ciudad ya que este es su único medio de ingresos, a el le gustaría darse a conocer  para que las personas que necesiten acarrear algún objeto lo contraten, se siente  satisfecho con la actividad a la que se dedica por eso el tiene las expectativas de continuar con este negocio hasta donde el pueda. Solicita este crédito para comprar otro caballo. Tiene como meta reparar su carreta actual y comprar otro caballo, contratar a alguien más para que trabaje en acarreo también. Pues este tipo de servicio es más accesible para personas de escasos recursos que no tienen para pagar transporte ya sea en camión , vehículos de acarreo.
texts.en: Freddy is from Granada, he has 9 children, who are all of legal age. He works carrying objects from one place to another for a living. He has been doing this for 24 years. He began in this activity, because it is what his father did for a living, and he inherited the cart with the horse when he was 23 years old. This is his source of income. Formerly, his children helped him, but now that they are all married, he does it on his own, working all over the town, since this is his only source of income. He would like to become well known so that people who need to transport something will hire him. He feels satisfied with the activity he does, that's why he expects to continue with this business for as long as he can. He requests this loan to buy another horse. His goal is to fix his current cart and buy another horse, and hire someone else to do the transportation as well. This kind of service is more affordable for low income people who can't afford to pay for a truck or other vehicles to transport their things.

loans.use: to buy a horse

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto tiene 30 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta hacer deporte como el boli.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto, 30, is married and lives with his wife and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  The members of the “Señor de la Salud” communal bank are located in Recinto Soloma that belongs to Echeandia Canton.  This communal bank is involved in short cycle corn and rice farming.

He grows corn and rice.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas and his sales take place in the street markets every day but especially on Sundays.

He requests the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  He faces challenges like infestations, plant diseases and climate variations.  His dream is to buy a parcel of land.  He likes to play sports like volleyball.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a large quantities of sorghum to make local drinks for resale.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en: Roel is 39 years old and married with two children. He resides in Balugo, Tambulig (Philippines). Roel operates a farming venture, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for five years. Each month, he earns 6,000 PHP from his business. He has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers for his farm, such as manure. In 2009, Roel joined GDMPC. In the future, Roel wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase another farm plot.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Atapana

texts.en: Atapana is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for many years. Atapana has requested a loan to buy things for her pancakes/plantation. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Atapana will save more and use her profit to help her family income.

loans.use: to buy items such as a knife, flour, oil, a fryer, sugar, baking soda and yeast

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms Parween is 44 years old.  She is an energetic woman and enjoys doing the work of hand embroidery, which she has done for 20 years.  Her embroidery patterns are very much admired in her community. She is happily doing it to support her family.

She is a responsible mother of seven children. Only two of them are in school as she is unable to cover the education expenses of her other children. Her husband is suffering from tuberculosis and unable to support his family. His parents are also living with them.  Hence, she is paying all expenses  on her own and provides her family with the basic necessities of life, including food, clothes and education. 

Now she requested a loan of Rs.20,000 from Kashf foundation. In this way she can manage to buy more frames, needles, beats, and threads of different colors.  All this will help in increasing sales and meeting demand without fail. 

She hopes to have more income, which will be used for the betterment of her family and for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more frames, needles, beats, and threads of different colors.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 3o ans célibataire mère trois enfants dont l'age varie entre 5 et 12 ans tous vont à l'école. Elle est couturière et a ouvert un atelier de couture depuis 2 ans déjà dans lequel elle fait la confection des tenus scolaires dans un quartier de la capitale. son activté rapporte plus pendant les rentrées scolaires parce que la tenue est un vêtement important pour les élèves. C'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce crédit pour s'acheter un rouleau de tissus et le matériel de couture pour la confection des tenues. ceci augmentera sa production, et donc ses ventes ainsi que ses bénéfices. Elle économisera une partie des bénéfices générés par ce crédit dans son activité pour augmenter le matériel et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie is a 30-year-old single woman and the mother of three children, ranging in ages between 5 and 12 years old.  Her three children go to school.

Marie is a seamstress and, two years ago, she opened a sewing shop in one of the neighborhoods of the capital city.  She makes school uniforms, which are an important clothing item for students.  This is why her activity is most profitable at the beginning of the school year. 

This is also the reason why she is requesting a loan to buy a roll of fabric and the sewing material necessary to make uniforms.  This loan will allow her to increase her production, and therefore her sales and profits.

Part of the profits generated thanks to this loan will be saved to buy more material for her business.  The rest will be used to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy small sewing material and rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Wilmer Wilfrido

texts.es:
Wilmer Wilfrido tiene 20 años, Es soltero vive con los padres, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Wilmer se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:

He grows corn and rice.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas and his sales take place in the street markets every day but especially on Sundays.

He requests the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  He faces challenges like infestations, plant diseases and climate variations.  His dream is to buy a parcel of land.  He likes to play sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

Le gusta hacer deporte todos los dias.

Luis Armando, 27, is married living with his wife and children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  The members of the “Señor de la Salud” communal bank are located in Recinto Soloma that belongs to Echeandia Canton.  This communal bank is involved in short cycle corn and rice farming.

He grows corn and rice.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas and his sales take place in the street markets every day but especially on Sundays.

He requests the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  He faces challenges like infestations, plant diseases and climate variations.  His dream is to buy three cuadras [unit of land measurement] of land.  He likes to play sports every day.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

He grows corn and rice.  He makes his purchases in Ventanas and his sales take place in the street markets every day but especially on Sundays.

He requests the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  He faces challenges like infestations, plant diseases and climate variations.  His dream is to buy a car.  He likes to play sports.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.en: Edgar is 48 years old, lives at Lintugop, Aurora, and is married with 4 kids. Edgar operates a fishing business to earn a living and has been 15 years in this business. Each month, he earns 6,000 doing this type of business. He requested a loan of 15,000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Edgar been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Edgar wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.

loans.name: Puperta

texts.en: Puperta is from Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay. She is 57 years old, married and has 2 children. To make a living, Puperta owns and operates a manufacturing business. Puperta has been engaged in her business for 9 years and earns 4,000 a month for these activities. In 2009, Puperta joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture new products and to pay for labor costs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture new products and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema began her business with the help of her husband when she received funding to start her food selling business. Thanks to the entrepreneurial support given to her and to her excellent administration of it, she has increased her capital, and her sales are increasing daily as well.

At age 33, she feels satisfied to have been able to have had such success in such a short time.   Because of this, she continues to work every Monday through Sunday without resting. 

In her business, she offers a great variety of products, like fried potatoes, dumplings, and flat breads. In the future, she hopes to expand her location in Msambweni with the help of her spouse.  With what she is making from her business, she will achieve her goal in a short time. 

She plans to purchase ingredients, such as wheat flour, rice, potatoes, and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, such as wheat flour, rice, potatoes, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is 29 years old and is married with two children aged 5 and 9 years old. His business is well organized. He starts at 7am and works until 8pm every day. He has three years of experience.

Jerome has requested a loan from Kiva partner Vision Finance Company in order to buy more clothes for resale. With the profit from this loan, Jerome will pay his children's school fees and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Oswaldo Alejandro

texts.es:
Oswaldo Alejandro tiene 45 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con un nieto. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz.

Oswaldo Alejandro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Las comprar y las ventas lo hace en la ciudad de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de urea, insecticidas, semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades.  El sueño es trabajar y tener capital.

En el tiempo libre le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Oswaldo Alejandro, 45, is married living with his wife and his grandson in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  The “San Francisco de Sibimbe” communal bank is located in Recinto Sibimbe that belongs to Ventanas Canton.  This communal bank has 20 members and is involved in short cycle corn and rice farming.

He grows corn and rice.  He makes his purchases and his sales in Ventanas.

He requests the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea and manure.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  His dream is to work and to have capital.  He likes to play sports in his free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Wilmer Reinaldo

texts.es:
Wilmer Reinaldo tiene 25 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Wilmer se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar un carro.

Le gusta caminar por el campo.
texts.en:
Wilmer Reinaldo is 25 years old; he is married and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas neighborhood, Province of los Ríos.

The members of the V.R.C. Lord of Health communal bank are located in the Soloma precinct, part the Echeandia neighborhood, it is mostly inhabited by people who work in agriculture growing corn and rice.

Wilmer works in agriculture harvesting corn and rice; he buys his items in Ventanas and sells them in markets everyday but especially on Sundays.

Wilmer needs a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure. The loan will help him financially to meet his needs and to face challenges like plagues and disease that hurt his crops as well as the variation in climate. Wilmer’s dream is to buy a car.

He enjoys walking through the fields.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, and compost.

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo  tiene 45 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta jugar boly.
texts.en:
Segundo Manuel is 45 years old, married and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas canton of Los Ríos province.

The members of V.R.C. Lord of Health communal bank, are located in the Recinto Soloma, part of Echeandia canton and are dedicated to farming short season crops such as corn and rice.

Segundo is a farmer and has corn and rice crops, he buys his items in Ventanas and sells his products in the farmer’s market everyday, especially on Sundays.

Segundo needs a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure. The loan will help him buy the agricultural inputs he needs. He faces challenges such as crop pests and diseases as well as changes in weather. His dream is to buy a ranch.

Segundo enjoys playing boly.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Tontine Bonheur Group

texts.fr: Aidé par 03 personnes dans l’exercice de son activité, Mr Alidou est cultivateur de profession. Il exerce son activité en REGION CENTRALE  depuis 2005. Homme de 43ans, père de 05 enfants dont 03 scolarisés et ayant pour femme une ménagère, Mr Alidou responsable du groupement TONTINE BONHEUR dont il fait partie il y a un moment sollicite l’aide de WAGES par un quatrième prêt pour s’approvisionner en outils de travail. Il voudrait acheter une moto, augmenter une superficie et construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Alidou is a professional farmer who has been working in the Central Region since 2005.  Three people help him with his farming business.  

Alidou is 43 years old and married to a homemaker.  He has five children, three of whom go to school.  He has been the leading member of the TONTINE BONHEUR savings group for quite some time, and he is requesting a fourth loan from WAGES for the purchase of farming tools.

He would like to buy a motorcycle, increase his surface area and build his own house.

loans.use: to buy farming tools.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
For over two years, Lilia, a 54-year-old, single woman, has made a living in Alegria, Aurora, through the operation of a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 6,000 a month for these activities.
In 2007, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (a brand of malted milk), shampoo, soaps etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps etc.

loans.name: Pedro Alejandrino

texts.es:
Pedro Alejandrino tiene 56 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Pedro se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar mas terreno para seguir trabanjo y dejar a los hijos de herencia.

Le gusta hacer deporte y reunirse con la familia.
texts.en:
Pedro Alejandrino is 56 years old; he is married and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas neighborhood, Province of los Ríos.

The members of the V.R.C. Lord of Health communal bank are located in the Soloma precinct, part the Echeandia neighborhood, it is mostly inhabited by people who work in agriculture growing corn and rice.

Pedro works in agriculture harvesting corn and rice; he buys his items in Ventanas and sells them in markets everyday but especially on Sundays.

Pedro needs a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure. The loan will help him financially to meet his needs and to face challenges like plagues and disease that hurt his crops as well as the variation in climate. Pedro’s dream is to buy more land to keep working and to leave his children an inheritance.

He enjoys playing sports and spending time with his family.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer and manure.

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo  tiene 45 años de edad es casado tiene 6 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos vive en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

La VRC SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandía, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, yuca, plátano, etc.
Segundo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz. 

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar insumos, fertilizantes, urea, abonos, semillas, con la ayuda del crédito ha podido mejorar el estilo de vida y mejorar los cultivos.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas. El sueño es poder tener más terreno para poder sembrar más y poder cultivar aún más.

El desafío que tiene y piensa cumplir es que los hijos culminen los estudios y sean profesionales que puedan trabajar.

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Segundo is 45 years old; he is married and lives with his wife and six children in the Ventanas neighborhood, Province of los Ríos.

The members of the V.R.C. Lord of Health communal bank are located in the Soloma precinct, part the Echeandia neighborhood, it is mostly inhabited by people who work in agriculture growing corn, rice, yucca, plantains, etc.

Segundo works in agriculture harvesting corn and rice.

Segundo needs a loan to buy supplies, fertilizers, ureide, manure and seeds. The loan will help him improve his quality of life and his crops.

He buys and sells his merchandize in Ventanas. Segundo’s dream is to have more land to be able to grow and harvest more plants.

The challenge that he has and plans to overcome is that his children finish their educations and they become professionals and are able to work.

In his free time, Segundo enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: buy supplies, fertilizers, ureide, manure and seeds.

loans.name: Elvia Leonor

texts.es:
Elvia  tiene 23 años, Es soltera vive con los padres, no tiene hijos vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SEÑOR DE LA SALUD, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Soloma, perteneciente al Cantón Echeandia, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Elvia se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de maíz y arroz, las compras las realiza en Ventanas y las vende en las ferias de todos los días en especial  la de los domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos  y la variación del clima. Su sueño es comprar una desgranadora de maiz.

Le gusta trabajar en la agricultura y ayudar a los padres.
texts.en:
Elvia is 23 years old; she is single and lives with her parents in the Ventanas neighborhood, Province of los Ríos.

The members of the V.R.C. Lord of Health communal bank are located in the Soloma precinct, part the Echeandia neighborhood, it is mostly inhabited by people who work in agriculture growing corn and rice.

Elvia works in agriculture harvesting corn and rice; she buys her items in Ventanas and sells them in markets everyday but especially on Sundays.

Elvia needs a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure. The loan will help her to financially meet her needs and to face challenges like plagues and disease that hurt her crops as well as the variation in climate. Elvia’s dream is to a corn sheller.

She likes working in agriculture and helping out her parents.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: La Sra. Raquel es originaria de Monterrey, Nuevo Leon. sus padres emigraron del vecino estado de San Luis Potosi para buscar mejor calidad de vida. Ella se caso a los 15 años con el Sr. Lucas quien se dedica a la carpinteria. Ellos procrearon 3 hijos los cuales son: Berenice de 18 años, Natali de 17 años y Gerardo de 12 años, estudiantes de Preparatoria y Secundaria. La  Sra. Raquel  dadas las crecientes necesidades de sus hijos sobre todo para su educacion ha decidido establecer un negocio de frutas,  verduras y abarrotes; empezando a vender en las puertas de su hogar, para posteriormente establecer un local chico en su mismo hogar. Hoy ella esta muy contenta, ya que ha crecido poco a poco, y con el crédito solicitado va a incrementar el surtido de fruteria y abarrotes para asi obtener mayores ventas y cumplir con el objetivo de tener un incremento en las ganancias y poder sacar adelante sus hijos.
texts.en: Mrs. Raquel is originally from Monterrey, Nuevo Leon, but her parents migrated to the neighboring state of San Luis Potosi in search of a better quality of life. She got married at 15 years of age to Mr. Lucas who works as a carpenter. They have 3 children, Berenice who is 18, Natali is 17, and Gerardo is 12 years old, and they all attend school or high school. Mrs. Raquel due to the recent needs of her children, especially for their education, decided to start a business selling fruits, vegetables and groceries. She started selling items at her doorstep and later opened a small store in her home. At present, Mrs. Raquel is very happy since she has grown little by little and with the loan she will be able to stock her store with fruits and groceries to have more sales and to meet her goal of increasing her earnings to help her children get ahead in life.

loans.use: stock her store with fruits and groceries.

loans.name: Mujeres Responsables Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Mujeres Responsables esta conformado por 8 integrantes de las cuales 7 son mujeres y un varón. Estos emprendedores son personas muy humilde, trabajadoras, responsables de buenas costumbres con muchos animo de superación personal. Todas ellos tienen negocio de artesanía que consiste en la elaboración de adornos de barro, ya que es la actividad fuerte de la localidad donde viven, la cual está ubicado en el occidente del país de Nicaragua. El banco comunal se reúnen para realizar las charlas previas al desembolso. En la foto aparece la cartulina de las capacitaciones que le ofrecen para el manejo de sus inversión como por ejem. motivarla al ahorro, inversión del crédito, y los reembolso en tiempo y forma. Su rutina diaria es levantarse a todos los días a las 6AM para sus labores diario a las 7 AM hasta las 5:30 pm para elaborar y ofrecer sus productos en el mercado de la localidad a clientes fijos y eventuales. Además trabajan de crédito con algunos clientes y recuperan quincenalmente. Los productos que ofrecen son: jarrones de barro, casa de barro, adornos de cocina, pimenteros de barro, saleros de barro entre otros.
texts.en: The Responsible Women communal bank is made up of 8 members of whom 7 are women, one is a man. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. All of them have businesses making handicrafts made from clay since it is what most people work with in the area where they live, which is located on the western part of Nicaragua. The communal bank meets to talk before they hand out the loans. In the picture you can see a board listing the services the bank offers like, motivating members to save, how to invest the loan, and how the loans are divided for repayment. Their daily routine is to wake up each morning at 6 a.m. to begin working at 7 a.m. until 5:30 p.m. as they make and offer their products in the local market to steady and potential customers. They also work selling their items on credit and get paid every two weeks. The products that they offer are: clay vases, clay houses, kitchen decorations, salt and pepper clay shakers and other items.

loans.use: buy materials to make clay vases, clay houses, kitchen decorations, salt and pepper clay shakers and other items.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is from Lapinig, Kapatagan. She is 26 years old and single. To make a living, she manages a fish pond where she raises fish to sell. She has been in her business for 2 years and earns 20,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

Aiza joined GDMPC in 2007. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to buy additional fish to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to raise.

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
Rosa es una señora de 59 años, se destaca por ser una persona trabajadora y muy feliz. Rosa vive con sus hijos menores, en total tiene 11 hijos.

Rosa es agricultora, trabaja en el sembrío de maíz, papas, arveja, fréjol, también se dedica a la crianza de animales como chanchos, borregos, cuyes, etc negocio que heredó de sus padres y es muy sustentoso para salir adelante con su familia, actualmente su sembrío necesita mantenimiento para que la producción sea de calidad, es por eso que realiza un nuevo crédito en fodemi el mismo que invertirá en la compra de abonos, fungicidas para el sembrío de papas y también para la compra de una vaca lechera.

Rosa sueña en construir canales de agua para riego ya que al momento sus terrenos no cuentan con esto, sueña también en que sus hijos sigan con su negocio y tengan mucho provecho.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 59 years old. She stands out as being a hardworking and happy person. Rosa lives with her younger children. She has a total of 11 children.  

Rosa is a farmer. She plants corn, potatoes, peas, and beans. She also raises animals such as pigs, sheep, guinea pigs, etc. She inherited this business from her parents and with it she gets ahead with her family. Right now her crops need maintenance so that the production will be of quality. That is why she is taking out a new loan in Fodemi. She will invest in buying fertilizer and fungicide for her potato crop and also in buying a dairy cow.

Rosa's dream is to build irrigation diitches since now her land doesn't have them. Her dream is also for her children to continue in their business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicides to plant potaoes and also to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Ms. Shahnaz is currently running a stitching school in her house. She is known around town as the best stitching teacher in town. She has been in business for seven years now and says that these seven years have been a blessing. She provides for her four children who are going to school, because unlike other children in town, their mother is able to pay for their education. 

While speaking to Kashf's team, Ms. Shahnaz shared that life was not like this before. She, along with her husband and children, lived in a broken down, one-room house with the minimum of necessities. Taking a loan from Kashf helped her account for expenses she thought she could never bear. 

Now, she has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase new stitching machines, threads, needles and other wants to accommodate two new students, increasing the total number of students to seven. Ms. Shahnaz decided to use the profits for the well-being of her family and to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase new stitching machines, threads, needles and other wants to accommodate two new students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to waterproof, repair, and paint his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials (sand, cement, and zinc).

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es una persona trabajadora, colaborador y de muy buen caracter. Jorge vive con sus padres en Cayambe.

Jorge trabaja solo en la crianza de cerdos, este negocio empezó gracias alas enseñanzas de sus padres hace dos años, este negocio es una fuente de ingresos que ayudan a solventar sus gastos y sus estudios, Jorge necesita incrementar su negocio, es por eso que solicita un crédito a Fodemi que va a ser invertido en la compra de chanchos reproductores y para la compra de balanceado para la alimentación.

Jorge sueña en tener un criadero grande de chanchos y poder distribuir a empresas grandes a nivel nacional.
texts.en:
Jorge is a hardworking, helpful person of very good character. Jorge lives with his parents in Cayambe.

Jorge works alone, raising pigs. This business began two years ago, thanks to his parents' teachings. This business is a source of income that helps to cover his expenses and his education. Jorge needs to increase the size of his business, which is why he is requesting a loan from Fodemi to be invested in the purchase of brood sows and pelleted feed for their diet.

Jorge dreams of having a large pig breeding operation and to be able to distribute to large companies at the national level.

loans.use: to purchase brood sows and pelleted feed for their diet.

loans.name: Cirila Emilia

texts.es:
La Sra. Cirila tiene 68 años. Esta casada con el Señor Máximo, quien es jubilado. Tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad. A pesar de ver a sus hijos ya profesionales e independientes, ella anhela servir de ejemplo a sus nietos, heredar sus conocmientos culinarios y perpetuar el rubro con ellos, tambien desea seguir siendo una persona emprendedora junto con su marido, a quien aqueja una enfermedad, pero esta actividad lo fortalece para vencer las adversidades.
Ella ofrece servicios de comidas y bocaditos para pequeños eventos, además de tortas y bocaditos dulces, reposteria en general.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de huevo, harinas, leches, etc.
texts.en:
Cirila is 68 years old. She is married to Máximo, who is retired. She has three children, all of which are adults. 

Despite already witnessing her children as professionals and independents, she strives to be a role model for her grandchildren; she passes down her culinary knowledge and perpetuates its arts with them. In addition, she wants to continue being entrepreneurial with her husband, who suffers from a disease. Nevertheless, this job strengthens them to overcome their challenges. 

She provides food and snack services for small events in addition to preparing sandwiches, sweet snacks, and pastry-making in general. 

She requests a loan to purchase eggs, flour, milk, and other things.

loans.use: to buy eggs, flour, milk, and other things.

loans.name: Nancy Elena

texts.es: Nancy de 53 años de edad vive en Ciudad Bicentenario un macroproyecto de vivienda de interés social en la ciudad de  Cartagena, apoyado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en el marco de cumplir su propósito de gestionar  la construcción  de comunidades sostenibles. Nancy conforma un grupo familiar con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos de 21 a 27 años de edad, con quienes sueña ver que logren sus propósitos de éxito en sus vidas. Nancy desde hace 3 Años emprendió su microempresa de confecciones, pues gracias a los cursos que realizó en el los centros productivos auspiciados por la Fundación Santo Domingo y con su aprendizaje empezó a ofrecer el servicio de costura sobre medidas, con una máquina que compró. En la actualidad elabora multiusos a todo costo y también blusas y pantalones y los vende a otros pueblos cercanos y a clientas que habitan en la comunidad donde habita. Sus ventas las realiza  de contado y a crédito, y sus compras las hace de contado en centros especializados de insumos de confecciones ubicados en el centro de la ciudad. Nancy ha recibido 4 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con los cuales ha logrado adquirir maquinarias y equipos de trabajo y su meta es continuar creciendo e independizar su negocio de su espacio familiar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará telas de lino, franela dacrón y chifon, hilos, adornos encajes, botones, con los cuales diseñará nuevos productos, para complacer a su buena clientela y es que invertir en su negocio es ganar-ganar.
texts.en: Nancy is 53 years old. She lives in Ciudad Bicentenario, a housing project in the city of Cartagena. It is supported by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. It's purpose is to promote the construction of sustainable communities. Nancy is married and has 4 children, aged 21 to 27. She dreams of seeing them achieve their goals of success in their lives. Three years ago, Nancy opened her micro business sewing clothes.Thanks to some classes she took at the productive centers sponsored by the Fundación Santo Domingo. With her learning she started to sew for people to order with a machine that she bought. Now she makes multiuse clothes and also blouses and pants. She sells them in other nearby towns  and to customers that lives in her community. She charges upfront and also sell son credit. She buys her materials upfront in specialized centers for sewing located in the center of town.  Nancy has received 4 loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With them she has been able to acquire machinery and work equipment. Her goal is to keep growing and seperate her business from her family space. Right now, she is applying for a new Kiva loan to buy linen, flannel, dacron and chiffon, thread, notions, and buttons. With them she will design new products to please her good customers. Investing in her business is win-win.

loans.use: to buy linen, flannel, dacron, chiffon, thread, notions, and buttons.

loans.name: Melianus

texts.en: Melianus is a 46-year-old man. He is still single and is living with his parents. As the only child who lives with his parents, Melianus realizes that he is responsible to meet the family necessities. Melianus generates income for his family by running a pig breeding business. His business activities include feeding the piglets, cleaning the pig stall, and selling the pigs at the market when they reached standard weight. Sometimes the customers come directly to his house to buy the fattened pig.  Melianus is grateful that the income from the business has enabled him to meet the family needs even though it is unstable. He is dreaming of improving his income by purchasing three more piglets, food, and enlarging the pig stall. To cover the business expansion costs, Melianus is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 6,000,000.

loans.use: to purchase 3 more piglets, food, and to enlarge the pig stall.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio con su anterior Crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  compró una fotocopiadora  multifuncional y planes de minutos a celulares e internet..
