Con esta inversión su capital de trabajo se incrementó y hoy en día ha logrado incursionar en un negocio de venta de ropa, calzado y accesorios de marcas reconocidas, que trae directamente de la ciudad de Medellín, en el departamento de Antioquia,  donde las producen con una calidad inigualable.  Él quiere manifestar  asociado   un amigo ha logrado este último negocio de mercancía variada y muy fina, que exhibe en su fotografía; pero la combina perfectamente  con su oferta de servicios de telecomunicaciones mediante el internet, vía telefónica y a través de transcripciones y servicio de fotocopiaje. Su meta mas adelante es surtir los pequeños negocios en la zona más comercial de la ciudad: “El centro de Barranquilla”. Su mensaje a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo es el siguiente: “Gracias a ustedes he podido venir haciendo realidad el sueño de empresario, y también se debe a la dedicación, trabajo persistente y disciplina, por que contar con ese apoyo financiero, ha materializado la idea que tenia. “  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el que comprará mercancía como ropa, calzado y accesorios femeninos que traerá desde la capital de las Flores,  Medellín, hermosa ciudad en el departamento  de Antioquia.
texts.en:
Julio bought a multifunctional copying machine and cell phone and internet minute plans with his previous loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  With this investment his working capital increased and today he has been able to start a business selling clothing, shoes and name brand accessories that he brings directly from Medellin, Antioquia department where an unequaled quality of products is produced.

He wants to let you know that in partnership with a friend he has achieved this other business of a variety of high quality merchandise that he shows in the photo.  It combines perfectly with his offering of telecommunication services on the internet, cell phones, and through transcriptions and photocopying.  
His future goal is to set up his small businesses in the most commercial zones of the city “The Center of Barranquilla”.  His message to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation is the following,  “Thanks to you I have been able to make my entrepreneurial dream a reality and also due to dedication and consistent work and discipline, and being able to count on this financial support, the idea that I have has come true”.  Currently he is applying for a loan with Credikiva to buy merchandise such as clothing, shoes and women’s accessories that he will bring from the capital of Las Flores, Medellin, the beautiful city in Antioquia department.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothing, shoes and women's accessories

loans.name: Vendeline

texts.fr: vendeline est une jeune femme de 26 ans fiancée mère de trois enfants. deux sont scolarisés. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale ou elle vend les vivres frais en fonction des saisons et du charbon depuis 6 ans.grace à son expérience et surtout les prix pratiqués lui ont permis de conquerir et fideliser une clientèle au fil du temps. La modicité de son capital de lui permet de renouveller le stock de ses marchandises à temps parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tout son stock pour pouvoir s'approvisionner à nouveau d'où la rupture permanente de ses stocks. elle sollicte un crédit pour acheter en gros (un filet de charbon) et des régimes de plantains. ceci satisfera sa clientèle,augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Les bénéficec générés par ce crédit seront en partie réinvestis dans son activté et le reste l'aidera à s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Vendeline is a 26-year-old young woman. She is engaged, and the mother of three children, two of whom attend school. She is a shopkeeper in a market in the capital where she has been selling fresh food according to the season and charcoal for the last 6 years. Thanks to her experience and more importantly the current prices she has been able to attract and retain customers as time goes on.

Her small amount of capital allows Vendeline to refresh her stock of merchandise in time because she is forced to clear her stock in order to be able to stock back up again without running out of stock. She is requesting a loan to be able to purchase wholesale charcoal and plantains. This will meet Vendeline's customers' needs, will improve her sales and therefore her profit margin. The profits generated by this loan will be partially reinvested in her business and the remainder will help Vendeline to take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale charcoal and plantains

loans.name: Amtal

texts.en:
Ms. Amtal is a 51-year-old, active woman who has had a successful boutique for 20 years.  Her designs and stitching are much admired in her community.  She is happily doing it to support her family and strives hard to give them a decent life.  

She is the responsible mother of five children, and is responsible for providing them with good food, health and education.  She needs to earn more income to support her family well.  She has improved her business step-by-step by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation.  She is requesting a loan of Rs 20,000/- to buy more clothes and different colored threads to increase her sales.  She hopes to earn more profits and better support her family.

loans.use: To buy clothes and thread for her boutique.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is a 27-year-old married man from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He is a fisherman. This is the source of his income.
Herbert is asking for a loan to buy a new fishing net and fuel for the fishing boat. With these, he will be able to augment his daily catch, thus allowing him to sell more fish to the market.
In the future, Herbert dreamed of expanding his business and saving money for future schooling of his two young children.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing net and fuel for the fishing boat

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 21-year-old young, single man who lives with his parents.  He is the owner of barber shop and has two years of experience in this field.  Even though he has been in this business for only two years, he already has a lot of customers.  He says that secret of his success is his friendliness and professionalism.  His monthly income is 250 AZN.  He wants to get married next yea,r and wedding expenses will be high.  Hence, he needs to increase his income.  For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to buy new working tools and improve his work conditions.

loans.use: to buy new tools and improve conditions in his barber shop.

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: françoise est une femme mariée mère de 5 enfants, deux vont déjà à l'école. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale où elle commercialise les épices depuis  4 ans. Son activté fonctionne à merveille, elle acquise et fidelisé une clientèle au fil du temps. actuellement elle a juste un problème parce que son capital ne lui permet pas d'augmenter ses stocks d'épice, elle est obligée à chaque fois de faire écouler tous ses stocks d'épice afin de pouvoir s'approvisionner  à nouveau, d'où le mécontement de ses clients à cause des ruptures permanentes de stocks. cela pousse certains à se tourner vers la concurrence. c'est celà que françoise sollicte ce crédit qui lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses marchandises et de souvant s'approvisionner à temps. Cela lui, permettra de satisfaire toute sa clientèle, d'augmenter ses ventes et donc son bénéfice. Elle réinvestira une partie de se bénéfices dans son activté pour agrandir son comptoir et économisera le reste pour son activté.
texts.en:
Françoise is a married woman and mother of 5 children, two of whom already attend school. She is a shopkeeper in a market in the capital where she has sold spices for 4 years. Her business gets on remarkably well; she attracts and retains her customer base as time goes on.

Currently Françoise has one problem, which is that her available capital does not allow her to increase her stock of spices, so she is forced to run through all of her stock of spices in order to be able to afford to stock up on more, or she will disappoint her customers because of permanent shortages of her stock. This pushes some of her customers to turn to the competition.

It is for this reason that Françoise is requesting a loan which will allow her to increase her stock of merchandise and to stock up more often. This will allow her to satisfy all of her customers, increasing her sales and therefore her profits. She will reinvest a part of the profits from her business in order to grow her trade and she will save the rest for her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of spices (packages of spice cubes, bag of "dzanssang"...)

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
La señora María es empleada de una clínica de salud como enfermera y su esposo tiene un taller de mecánica, que esta en su casa. 
Están solicitando el préstamo para la construcción de un baño y no cuentan con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Con la construcción del baño será más cómodo para las visitas que tiene y los clientes del negocio de su esposo.
 La señora María pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo y que con las ganancias que obtiene su esposo del negocio se encargara de los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
María is employed as a nurse in a health clinic and her husband has a mechanic's shop that is at their house.

They are requesting the loan for the construction of a bathroom because they don't have the money necessary to buy the materials and pay the person responsible for doing the work. With the construction of a bathroom, it will be more comfortable for their visitors and for customers of María's husband's business. 

María will pay the loan back with the salary that she receives for her work, and her husband's earnings will take care of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to construct a bathroom in the front of her house.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda is a 45-year-old divorced woman raising one son alone. She is a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods, such as flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, and candies. She has 27 years of experience and has deep knowledge of the market and the demands of her clients. 

The food products she sells are very popular among people and are in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling food is 200 AZN.  Her son helps to purchase products and brings them to the shop. This is the sole financial income for her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of the good location of her market, which is in the central bazaar of her city.

Sevda applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods offered to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more food products.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 45-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. She has two children aged 12 and 8 years old. 
Imelda has been in the hog raising business for more than 8 years now. She is also engaged in a retailing and food vending business.
As of this time, Imelda is in need of additional capital for her ventures. She is asking for a loan worth 3,000 PHP to buy feeds for the pigs and to buy cooking ingredients for her food vending business.
Imelda dreams of expanding her business to earn more in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds for the pigs and to buy cooking ingredients for her food vending business

loans.name: Asociación Ybycuí Group

texts.es:
En total son 11 mujeres que se dedican exclusivamente a la artesania,todas generan ingresos semanalmente por tal motivo es de suma importancia el crédito para la elaboración de sus  colchas, manteles, hamacas .Ellas pretenden mejorar su calidad de trabajo, estan motivadas en sus actividades con el deseo de mejorar su ingresos.
Una de las integrantes del grupo, la sra. Jacinta, realiza de manera permanente artesanías varias; con esto ella ayuda económicamente a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar sus insumos como pinturas, pinceles, hilos, encajes, etc.
texts.en: There a total of eleven women dedicated exclusively to creating artisanal crafts and they all generate weekly income. Therefore, the loan is extremely important for the creation of their bedspreads, tablecloths, and hammocks.  They intend to improve the quality of their craftsmanship and they are motivated by their desire to improve their income.  One of the members of the group, Jacinta, makes various crafts on an ongoing basis and helps support her family financially with this income.  She is requesting the loan to purchase supplies such as paints, paintbrushes, thread, lace, etc.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as paints, paintbrushes, thread, lace, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Liza

texts.en:
Ma. Liza is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of six children who are still in school. They live in Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Ma. Liza has been in the fishing business for more than 20 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Ma. Liza needs more capital for her business. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fishing nets and repair their fishing boat. With help from this loan, her husband can enhance his daily catch and have the chance to sell more fish to the market.

Ma. Liza dreams of expanding the business so that it will generate more revenue and she can continually support her husband in sending their children to school for a better education and a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and repair their fishing boat.

loans.name: Ali Gabriela

texts.es:
El Sr. Ali Gabriel es comerciante tiene un  tramo en el mercado municipal san Rafael del sur, Managua Nicaragua tiene veinte y ocho años, es casado tiene dos hijos.
Su actividad comercial consiste en la venta de electrodomésticos como: televisores, radio grabadora, equipo de sonido, horno microonda, abanicos también vende ropa nueva para varón camisetas, pantalones, shores, gorras. 
Antes de tener su propio negocio le ayudaba a su mama a trabajar en el mercado ya que su mama tiene tres tramos en el mercado, pero después sus padres le ayudaron para que se independizara y obtuviera sus propios ingresos para la manutención de su familia, tiene casa propia.
Con el financiamiento que ceprodel le ha otorgado pretende incrementar sus utilidades y ingresar un nuevo producto a su negocio como es el zapato que muchos de sus clientes le preguntan.
texts.en: Ali Gabriel is a merchant and has a market space in the “San Rafael del Sur” town market in Managua, Nicaragua.  He is 28 years old and married with two children.  His business consists of selling electrical appliances such as televisions, radios, recorders, sound equipment, microwave ovens, and fans.  He also sells new clothing for gentlemen including T-shirts, pants, shorts, and caps. Before having his own business, he worked in the market helping his mother as she had three stalls.  But later, his parents helped him so that he could become independent and earn his own income to support his family and have his own home.With the loan that Ceprodel has granted him, he plans to increase his profits and introduce a new product to his business such as the shoes that many of his clients request.

loans.use: to purchase men's shoes: leather sneakers and sport shoes.

loans.name: G.s. Fuente De Vida El Retiro Group

texts.es: Doña Teodora, de 62 años de edad, soltera, tiene 7 hijos, vive en el municipio de Arizona Atlántida, junto a su hijo, nuera y un nieto. Hace más de un año que ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de productos de bisutería como ser: collares, anillos, aretes, y pulseras. Este producto es elaborado manualmente, con pinzas y de varios diseños a petición del cliente y es vendida en la comunidad. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras para comprar más materiales como alambre, piedras, remaches, broches y otros para hacer productos de bisutería. Con esta inversión ampliara su negocio para generar más ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida individual y familiar. El préstamo que solicita es en grupo el cual se llama Fuente de vida el retiro y  está formado por tres personas que en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta Teresa quien tiene una pulpería, en el centro esta Teodora y a la derecha María Irma, quienes viven en la misma comunidad.
texts.en: Teodora, 62, is single and has 7 children.  She lives in the municipality of Arizona Atlántida with her son, daughter-in-law and a grandchild.  More than a year ago, she started a business making and selling costume jewelry, such as: necklaces, rings, earrings and bracelets.  She makes these products by hand, with tweezers.  She makes a variety of designs based on the requests of her customers, and her products are sold in the community.  She is requesting a loan for 5,000 Honduran lempiras to buy more supplies, such as: wire, stones, rivets, clasps, and other items to make the jewelry.  With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family.  She is requesting a loan within a communal bank called "Fuente de la Vida El Retiro."  The group is made up of 3 people who are identified in the photo as follows: at the left is Teresa, who has a grocery store; in the center is Teodora; and at the right is Maria Irma.  They all live in the same community.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make jewelry such as: wire, colored stones, pin backs, clasps, hoops and other items

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a merchant from Bohol, Philippines. She is 36 years old and has run a sari-sari (or convenience) store for more than three years now.

Nelia is a hardworking woman wiling to give her best for the family. Nelia is asking for a loan worth 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy more stock for her store, such as canned goods, personal care materials and other household and cooking materials. Through this loan, Nelia will be able to attract and cater to more customers and buyers in her store.

In the future, Nelia dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to continually send her children to school for better learning and education.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store, such as canned goods, personal care materials and other household and cooking materials.

loans.name: Tontine Panapassa Group

texts.fr: Composé de 12 membres, le groupe de solidarité TONTINE PANAPASSA a pour président Pani. Âgé de 36 ans, Pani est marié à une revendeuse et est père de famille de quatre enfants. Trois de ses enfants sont actuellement scolarisés. Son ainé a 13 ans et son jeune enfant est âgé de 18mois.  Pani exerce son métier de cultivateur depuis 2000 et se fait aider dans l’exercice de ses fonctions par 10 employés. Son activité, qui consiste à la culture du maïs et du riz se localise à Pagala Gare. Pour renforcer son activité par l’achat des outils nécessaire à son activité, Pani sollicite une fois encore le soutien financier de WAGES en qui il fait toujours confiance. Il souhaite ainsi dans les jours à venir augmenter sa superficie cultivable et construire de nouveaux bâtiments en dur pour sa famille. Les autres membres du groupe exercent la même activité que leur président.
texts.en: Made up of 12 members, the solidarity group TONTINE PANAPASSA has Pani as its president.  He is 36 years old, married to a saleswoman, and is the head of a family with four children.  Three of these children are now attending school.  His oldest is 13 years old and his youngest is 18 months.  Pani has been working as a farmer since 2000 and he has 10 people who work for him.  His business, which is cultivating corn and rice, is located in Pagala Gare.  In order to build up his business with the purchase of some necessary tools, Pani is requesting more financial assistance from WAGES, whom he trusts to help him.  He also wants, in the near future, to increase the size of his farm and to construct sturdy housing for his family.  The other members of the group do the same kind of work as their president.

loans.use: to buy tools for his work.

loans.name: Mosa

texts.en:
Mosa is involved in making and selling meals in her small food stall. Her stall is located at a strategic place along one of the busy streets in the town. She has been in this business for the last two years; thanks to her efforts and caring nature, she has an uncountable clientele.

Mosa has applied for this loan to add more dishes at her stall. This is important for her to meet her clients' demand and increase sales. Mosa plans to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar, baking powder, cooking oil, etc.

She lives with her husband, Masudi, and three children.

Development of the business will bring more income for Mosa and help her to cover the family's costs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, sugar, baking powder, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
Nicanora is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of three grown children. She lives in Bohol, Philippines. She has been in the egg/poultry retailing business for more than 12 years now. This is the source of their income.

Nicanora is in need of additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy additional egg/poultry products to sell to the people in her community.

Nicanora hopes to improve her business and make it more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional egg/poultry products to sell

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena tiene 58 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama VRC SAN FRANCISCO DE SIBIMBE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Sibimbe, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta  ventanilla tiene 20socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembran maíz y arroz..

Maria Magdalena se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz,arroz, además se dedica a la cría de pollos, patos y cerdos. Las compras y las ventas lo realizarán en la ciudad de Ventanas cada 15 días.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, urea, fertilizantes , líquido mata maleza. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como plagas del cogollero, ratón y la lancha que dañan los cultivos. El sueño es comparase un terreno y construir una casa.

En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is 58 and lives with her husband and children. She lives in the Ventanas canton of the Los Rios province. 

The name of her solidarity lending group is VRC San Francisco de Sibimbe. They are located in the Sibimbe precinct, Ventanas canton. The group has 20 members who are all short cycle farmers who plan corn and rice. 

Maria Magdaena works in agriculture, planting corn and rice, in addition to raising chickens, ducks, and pigs. Every 15 days she goes to the city of Ventanas to do her buying and selling. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, urea and other fertilizers, and liquid herbicide. With the support of the loan, she will have the economic means to buy everything she needs. The challenges she faces are potato blight and pests, including armyworm and mice that damage her crops. Her dream is to purchase her own land and build a house. 

In her free time, she enjoys spending time with family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea and other types of fertilizer, and pesticide

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Yerevan with his wife and two daughters.
 
Armen is a tailor. He rents a little premises at one of markets in Yerevan, where he operates his business. Armen would like to purchase a new sewing machine, which will allow him to sew with more quality and faster. Armen also plans to renovate the premises he rents to make it more attractive for clients. This loan will help Armen to implement these goals and develop his business.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine and the renovation of the rented premises.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a 37-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. He has four young children who are 9, 5 and 2 years old and a month old baby. 

Rolando is a hardworking man. He is in need of additional capital for his business. Rolando is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy new fishing nets, and fuel for the boat and to pay for its repair and maintenance. Through this loan, Rolando will be able to enhance his catch, thus increasing the quantity of fish he has to sell to the market.

In the future, Rolando dreams of expanding his business so that it will generate more income for their needs and the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat and pay for repairs and maintenance

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Bohol, Philippines. Susana has been in the fishing business for more than two years now. Susana’s husband works as a fisherman.

Susana is in need of additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat and to pay for repairs and maintenance.

With this, Susana dreams of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat and to pay repairs and maintenance.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms Parveen is a 52-year-old self-motivated woman. One year ago, when her son fell ill, she thought she would lose him because paying the hospital bills seemed impossible. It was under such tremendous stress that she decided that her husband’s daily wages were too erratic to rely on for any sort of expense. She decided to open a general store in a small corner outside her house. This helped her bring a reliable source of income at home, pay her utility bills and save enough so her children can go to school. 

She is a responsible mother of six children and her dream is to send her children to school so ultimately they can work in an office and provide for their families in a much better way. She is satisfied with the support of Kashf Foundation and requests a repeat loan of Rs 35,000 /- to buy packs of bread, oils and biscuits to meet the demands of her customers. She will eventually use her profits on her children’s education and give them a respectable life.

loans.use: To buy bread, oil and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Ms Yasmeen is a 42-year-old widow whose husband died one year ago. He was running a general store business. But due to his death, she had to shut down the general store. After that, she started doing hand embroidery in her house with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns gained popularity in her community. Due to the increased demand for her embroidery designs, she is employing other women in her business.

She has two daughters and two sons. Being a single parent, she is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. In order to meet the growing demand of embroidery, she needs to employ some more women. Now she is requesting a loan of Rs 25,000 from Kashf foundation. In this way, she can manage to buy more frames, needles and threads of different colors, which will help in generating more income through more sales. She hopes to use her profits for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: To buy more frames, needles and threads of different colors to increase her sales.

loans.name: Majaliwa

texts.en:
Majaliwa is 27 years old and married to Musa. They have two children and she loves them very much. For three years, she has operated a business selling clothes door-to-door.

She has worked hard since she started and has been successful so far. For this reason, she is keen to buy more supplies. Ths is her first loan with Yehu. She is very grateful for the financial help she is receiving. It will allow her to improve her business and learn to save money.

Majaliwa will invest this money in the purchase of khangas and, if the money stretches far enough, she will buy some T-shirts and blouses.

loans.use: to buy khangas, T-shirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 37 years old and is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She lives in the Kwale district in a small village with her family that also includes her in-laws. 

Fatuma sells fried cassava and cassava chips at the market. She also does farming with her husband. She assists him during her free time and during weekends when her children are at home. They work hard on their land during the spring and summer seasons to get a good harvest. 

Fatuma is requesting a loan to purchase more cassava and cooking oil to sell later for a profit. Fatuma will reinvest her additional earnings to expand her business enterprise to make it more profitable and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mussa

texts.en: Mussa is 30 years old. He is married to a businesswoman and they have two children. He sells wood and has been in this business for nine years. Mussa wants the loan to buy more wood/timbers to sell. He plans to use the profits to renovate their house. Mussa wants to see his business prospering in the future.

loans.use: To buy more wood/timber to sell.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Ms Farzana is a 33-year-old strong lady who works at stitching. She is a master of this art and has a good client list. She is well known for her work in her community.  She has four children and wants them to get a higher education. For this purpose, she started this work 10 years ago to support her family along with her husband who is a rickshaw driver and not able to cover his family's expenses by himself
 
She has improved her business gradually and now has requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy stock of threads, zippers, buttons etc.to meet the increasing demand time after time. She hopes to earn more profit and use it on her children’s education and better living.

loans.use: To buy threads, zippers, buttons etc.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura continues managing her boutique. She’s a merchant who strives to move forward. With her own efforts and with Yehu loans, she’s been growing socially and economically. Zuhura is working hard to increase her income to support her children and to pay household expenses. She also gets help from her child’s father.

This lady is very responsible. She demonstrated responsibility and good payment behavior with her previous loan. She’s now requesting her third loan to improve her boutique, thus providing better conditions for her family and for the customers who visit her. She hopes her business will be big and that she and her children will be full of good health. With this loan, she will be able to purchase clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Nassoro

texts.en:
Nassoro is a 32-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be social and a talkative man. He operates a motorcycle with which he provides transport services. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located within a busy market. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor road networks that are impassible. In addition to this, Nassoro sells building blocks.

He will use the 40,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to service his motorcycle and to buy a chopping tool for making blocks. His business goal is to hire employees. He hopes that, in the future, he will educate his children up to the university level.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and buy a chopping tool for making blocks.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a devoted merchant who is interested in moving ahead. She has been running a cafe since last year. Asha started her cafe with her savings beginning with a small stall in her house: after some time, she started reinvesting and increasing her inventory. For the cafe, she buys products like rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, and other necessary ingredients.

Asha lives with her three children and her long-term partner in their simple-structure home. She said that her most difficult challenge is to improve her business, to have a successful cafe. She enjoys working in her business. Asha is very excited to be receiving her first loan from Yehu. She plans to save the profits for future investments and needs. She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, and other necessary ingredients.

loans.name: Anonciatha

texts.en: Anonciatha is 27 years old. She has been selling sorghum for seven years. With the loan, she plans to buy more sorghum to sell. Anonciatha plans to use the profits from the business to create savings.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, aged 46, provides services to brides on their wedding day. She makes available different formal and bridal dresses and also offers jewelry items for brides. People enjoy borrowing dresses at low charges from her only for their wedding day instead of buying them at higher prices in markets. 

She has four daughters and one son. He eldest daughter helps her, while the other children attend school. She is responsible for their food, education and health. She needs to generate more income in order to improve their standard of living.

This is her sixth year with Kashf Foundation and she has gradually improved her business through its support. Now, she is requesting a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy more bridal dresses and jewelry items to cater for more brides. In this way, she can accelerate her business growth and hence better support her family.

loans.use: To buy more bridal dresses and jewelry items to cater for more brides.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a very hardworking person dedicated 100 percent to her business. She lives with her husband and her seven children, in the rural area of Shirazi along the coastal region of Kenya. She has had her food selling business for more than two years, selling from her home.

Fatuma will invest her loan in the purchase of beans, wheat flour, firewood, sugar, and cooking oil. In this way, her sales will increase.

Fatuma hopes that with the loan, her sales will increase and she hopes to better satisfy the needs of her customers. She also hopes to obtain higher earnings to have a better life.

Fatuma’s dream is to be able to improve her business, making it larger, and to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase beans, wheat flour, firewood, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en:
Bayan is 45 years old and lives in the town of Mubende in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Bayan has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells dry beans, sugar, maize, flour and salt. 

To help expand her business, Bayan has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Bayan to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Bayan hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a commercial house. 

Bayan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Bayan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 32 years old and is the mother of three children. She is married to a house builder. She has been selling vegetables for the past seven years. 

Chantal has requested a loan to buy more vegetables to sell, such as eggplant and carrots. She plans to use the profits for savings and to make more efforts to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell, such as eggplant and carrots.

loans.name: Aalmay

texts.en:
Ms Aalmay is a lively 55-year-old woman who has enjoyed her work of making ‘Gol Gappe’ for 10 years. It is a popular street food dish in a country like Pakistan. It is a round, hollow puri, fried crisp and filled with a mixture of water, tamarind, chili, chaat masala, potato, onion and chickpeas. It is small enough to fit completely into one's mouth. She makes it on a daily basis and has become famous in her town.  

She has four daughters and one son. Her husband’s income is insufficient to meet the family's expenses. So she initiated her own business with the support of Kashf Fundation.  Now she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy ingredients in bulk such as semolina, plain refined flour, baking soda and oil to meet the increasing demand for her product.  She hopes to earn more profits and will use the profit for her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk such as semolina, plain refined flour, baking soda and oil.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine lives in Armash village, Ararat region, with her husband and two sons. Armine and her husband work at the local health center. They also run a farm to earn sufficient income for their family's costs. Armine and her husband breed hens and chickens and grow apricot, peach and grenade (similar to plum) trees. 

In order to complete the cultivation of the land, Armine has applied for this loan to purchase fertilizer, as well as to pay for watering the land and for hiring workers to do the cultivation. She also plans to purchase forage for the hens and chickens and stakes for the garden. These investments are important for Armine so she can have a stable income from agriculture and sustain her family.

loans.use: to pay for watering the land and for hiring workers, and to buy fertilizer, garden stakes and forage for the hens and chickens.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is 32 years old. She is the mother of six children aged between one month and 16 years. She has been selling beans and sorghum for the past 13 years. 

With the loan, Rachel wants to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for her family. She is very thankful for the business that has helped to provide necessities for her family.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Donathille

texts.en: Donathille is 43 years old. She is married and has three children aged between four and 16. She sells fabrics and threads. With the loan, Donathille wants to buy more fabrics to sell. The profits from her business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is in her early fifties, is married and has five children. Her oldest child, a son, lived in Greece for a short period of time until recently when he joined his mother in the business which they both plan to expand.  They all live in the north-eastern part of the country. 

For the past 12 years, Marie has been selling dairy products and baby calves to locals and the dairy market. Throughout the years, she has experienced a growth in the business and in the clientele.

Marie now wants to expand the animal stable in hope that all the animals she currently has and those she plans to soon add would all fit nicely in it. This is why she is requesting a loan this time. Her previous three loans from the same institution, the VFA, have all been repaid in full.

Marie wants to deliver special thanks to all Kiva lenders for their potential support.

loans.use: To expand the existing animal stable

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo, who is in charge of her own business, is 29 years old. Married and the mother of four children, three of whom are in school, she has been selling fish at the market for two years. She gets her supplies from fishmongers.

With the aim of increasing her sales and satisfying her clients' demands, Mwanakombo has resorted to the microfinance institution, Yehu, with the aim of maximizing her profit and supporting her children's schooling. She envisions opening a kiosk in the future. Mwanakombo will use her loan to buy 50 kilograms of fish and five litres of cooking oil.

loans.use: to buy 50 kilograms of fish and five litres of cooking oil.

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en: Anastasie is married to a driver. They have six children aged between 10 and 25, all of whom go to school. With the loan, Anastasie wants to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi, aged 29, is from the Kwale district. She is married with one child who is already enrolled in school. Mwanamisi has been running a retail shop for one year. She sells goods like flour, sodas, sweets, and other basic items. She works at the business every day, 11 hours per day. Mwanamisi's other source of income comes from her husband's income. She says that her business is doing fine.

Mwanamisi has requested a loan in order to buy more inventory to add to her stock of flour, rice, sugar, etc. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her child and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business into wholesale. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to increase her stock of flour, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 31 years old and is married to a house builder. They have  two children, both of whom are enrolled in school. Florence sells beans and bananas. With the loan, she wants to buy more bananas and beans to sell. The profits from the business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and beans to sell.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 36 years old and lives in West Point. She is married and has two children aged nine and 17 who live at home and attend school.

Christina has been selling cosmetics for the past five years and needs to expand her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics to sell. In the future, she plans to build houses and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Marie Ange

texts.en: Marie Ange is 29 years old. She is the mother of two children aged six and seven, both of whom go to school. She sells local beer. With the loan, Marie Ange wants to buy more local beer to sell. The profits will be used to renovate the business.

loans.use: To buy more local beer to sell.

loans.name: Arman

texts.en:
Arman lives in Kapan town with his wife, Kristine. He is involved in breeding lambs. Currently, the number of lambs on Arman's farm exceeds 150. He would like to purchase more lambs in order to earn more profit from the meat sales. This loan will allow him to purchase 40 lambs. 

Arman is excited about the expansion of his farm which will allow him to have sufficient income and to invest in starting other agricultural activities in the future.

loans.use: to buy lambs

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is very responsible and hard-working. She lives with her six children for whom she works hard day after day. Mwanatumu sells dumplings and flat breads, making and selling them at the market. She started this business out of a desire to be able to improve her family's financial situation, because they often didn't have enough money to cover their basic household costs. For that reason, Mwanatumu wants to be able to continue growing the business that has given her family economic stability. 

She is asking for a loan to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, and baking powder. This will help her a lot and she will be able to improve her business conditions and attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, cooking oil, and baking powder.

loans.name: Donatha

texts.en: Donatha is 32 years old and has one child aged four. She has been selling sorghum and beans for the past two years. With the loan, Donatha wants to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be set aside as savings.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 32 years old. She owns a hardware store. She has been running the business for eight years. She is married and has four children aged between seven months and eleven years. With the loan, she wants to add more hardware items for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more hardware items for sale.

loans.name: Nyambwana

texts.en:
Nyambwana is a person who has always been known for being very hardworking, and for wanting to provide a good quality of life for her family. Thanks to this, she has been able to overcome great adversities which life has presented to her. She continues operating her grocery store and also sells spare parts in a small store. She is seeking another loan which will allow her to buy tomatoes, kale, onions, etc.

In this way, she will be able to satisfy all of the demand for her product, and thus she will have better income for her family. Her greatest dream is to get ahead with her businesses and have better economic opportunities and a better quality of life in her home, in addition to generating employment for people who need it most.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, kale, onions, etc.

loans.name: Ditatchofala Group

texts.fr: Mr moussa vit avec sa femme revendeuse et leurs 12 enfants en REGION CENTRALE. 06 sont sur les bancs de l’école.  Il est cultivateur. Vu sa grande superficie, il emploie 20 employés pour l’avancement de l’activité. Il est dans ce domaine il y a 30ans et s’y plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus considérables pouvant l’aider à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Il sollicite ce premier prêt pour acheter des outils de travail afin d’avoir un bon rendement. Notons qu’il a été nommé par ses collègues pour être le responsable de leur groupement qui a pour nom « DITATCHOFALA ». Ils sont tous dans l’agriculture et cultivent du riz et du mais. Ils espèrent qu’avec ce crédit tirer des profits et assurer la bonne éducation aux enfants.
texts.en:
Moussa lives with his wife and 12 children in the Central Region. His wife works as a reseller, and six of his children go to school. He himself is a farmer and, due to the large size of his land, he employs 20 individuals to help with his business. He has worked in this profession for 30 years, and is happy with it as it gives him a considerable income which helps him provide for his family. 

Moussa has requested this first loan to buy work tools, so that he can have a good harvest. He was appointed by his colleagues to be the head of his group, which is called Ditatchofala. All the group members work in agriculture, growing rice and corn. They hope that this loan will allow them to generate profits, and also to ensure that their children get a good education.

loans.use: To buy work tools.

loans.name: Gulzina

texts.ru: Гулзине  32 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей, младшему сыну 2 года. Гулзина с 2000 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Гулзины имеется 1 дойная корова с приплодом, 1 лошадь, 2 га земли с посевом фасоли и картофеля,  ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 5,000 сом (KGS). Доходы позволяют Гулзине покрыть ежедневные расходы семьи на питание и бытовые нужды, а сезонная продажа фасоли позволила приобрести небольшой трактор, при помощи которого муж Гулзины  предоставляет услуги по обработке земли для местного населения. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулзина обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 лошадей. Доходы Гулзина планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, чтобы иметь возможность накопить средства на обучение детей.
texts.en:
Gulzina is 32 years old, married, and raising 3 children, the youngest of whom is 2. Since 2000, Gulzina has been farming and raising livestock, having started her business with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Presently, her farm includes 1 dairy cow with offspring and 1 horse, as well as 2 hectares of land with beans and potatoes, and earns around 5,000 som (KGS) per month. Gulzina's profits allow her to cover the family's daily food and household expenses, while the seasonal sale of beans has brought enough money to purchase a small tractor, which Gulzina's husband uses to offer land cultivation services to the local population.

In order to continue developing her business, Gulzina has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase 2 horses. She plans to invest her profits into further expansion of her business, so as to save enough money for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase two horses

loans.name: Benedic

texts.fr: est une jeune femme de 27 ans,mariée,mère de 02 enfants âgé de 01 et 09 ans, l'un des deux va déjà à l'école.Elle est commerçante et a ouvert une parfumerie qu'elle gère dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 04 ans.Sa petite parfumerie fonctionne assez bien,mais cependant l'abscence d'une diversification de son activité,et la petitesse de son stock de lait de toilette est un problème car la demande en bijoux et en lait de toilette étant de plus en plus croissante,elle a du mal à satisfaire cette demande de sa clientèle.C'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite ce crédit qui l'aidera à plus s'approvisionner en gros en produits cosmétiques, mèches et greffes. Ce qui lui permettra de satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle ,ce qui augmentera ses ventes et par conséquent ses bénéfices.Elle économisera une partie de ces bénéfices dans le but d'ouvrir dans un futur proche un bar et l'autre lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Benedic is a young, 27-year-old woman. She is married and is mother to two children, aged 1 and 9, one of whom is at school. She works as a retailer and opened a perfume store in a neighborhood of the capital four years ago, which she runs. Her little perfume store does fairly well, but she cannot diversify her business and has low stocks of cleansing lotion. This is a problem as, due to rising demand for jewelry and cleansing lotion, she finds it difficult to satisfy her customers’ requests.

It is for this reason that Benedic has requested this loan, which will help her to buy wholesale supplies of cosmetic products, hair extensions and hair weave. This will allow her to meet her customers’ requests, thereby increasing her sales and, consequently, her profits. She will save part of these profits as she plans to open a bar in the near future, and will also use part of the profit to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy wholesale hair weaves, hair extensions, and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy reams of paper, staples, ink, boxes of pens and envelopes.

loans.name: Emilia Albertina

texts.es:
La señora Emilia es comerciante, tiene un tramo ubicado en el mercado municipal san Rafael del sur Managua, Nicaragua tiene treinta y tres años de edad, es casada, su esposo trabaja con ella en la misma actividad comercial, tiene dos niños menores de edad,
Uno en edad escolar.
La actividad comercial a la que se dedica es venta de productos de abarrotería ( granos básicos; arroz, frijoles, maíz, trigo, azúcar, Harina, aceite, productos lácteos como: leche, crema, queso, mantequilla. Embutidos entre otros.
El dinero lo solicita para invertirlo en su negocio para la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar y trigo que son los productos que le representan mayor demanda. Se siente satisfecha con los financiamiento que se le han otorgado porque ha observado el crecimiento de su negocios y las utilidades se le han incrementado.
texts.en:
Emilia is a merchant and has a stall located in the municipal market of San Rafael del sur Managua, Nicaragua. She is 33 years old and is married. Her husband works with her in the same business. She has two young children, one of which is in school. 

She makers her living selling grocery products such as grains, rice, beans, corn, wheat, sugar, flour, oil, sausages, and dairy including milk, cream, cheese, and butter among others. 

She is requesting the loan to invest in her business to buy rice, oil, sugar, and wheat which are the products requested the most by customers. Emilia is satisfied with the loan she has been granted because she has seen her business grow and her profits have increased.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, and oil.

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es: Fátima es originaria de Granada de 25 años de edad, tiene 1 bebe de 9 meses de edad, se dedica a vender ropa usada y a vender tortillas. Fátima inicio su negocio comprando en tiendas ropa usada con dinero que le dio su esposo y con ahorros que tenia.  Dinero que obtenía  por elaborar tortillas desde tempranas horas de la mañana en casa de su mama ya que ella es la dueña de la tortillería y por las tardes sale a vender ropa siendo este su primer negocio. Se siente satisfecha de la zona donde ofrece su producto por que asegura que tiene buenos  clientes que siempre le compran porque sus prendas no son caras y de buena calidad. Ella ha solicitado este crédito para comprar más pacas de ropa y así ofrecer a sus clientes más variedad,  espera crecer en su negocio y mejorar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Fatima, 25, is originally from Granada and has a 9-month old baby. She makes her living selling used clothing and selling tortillas. Fatima started her business by buying clothes from stores using money her husband gave her and also money from her savings. She earned her savings making tortillas from early hours in the morning in her mother’s house, who is the owner of the tortilla store.

In the afternoon, she goes out to sell clothing as it is her first business. She is happy with the area where she sells her products because she has good customers that always buy from her because her clothing is not expensive and is good quality. 

She is requesting this loan to buy more bundles of clothing and in this way, offer her clients a greater variety. She expects to grow her business and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of clothing

loans.name: Tuchukuliane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira  est présidente du groupe d’affaire Tuchukuliane, âgée de 46 ans, mariée, mère de 11 enfants dont l’un fut décédé. Tous ses enfants étudient. Son conjoint est  un enseignant.  Elle est  vendeuse d’huile de palme. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari, plus tard, elle bénéficia un fond additionnel de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima et cela, vers les années 2002, après éruption du volcan Nyiragongo. Elle installe ses produits  au le marché. Il vient de réaliser 22 cycles de crédit dans le programme de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  6 bidons d’huile de palme. En plus, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle et construire une belle maison. La cliente salut l’initiative de l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Kavira is the president of the Tuchukuliane business group. She is 46 years of age, married, and mother of 11 children, one of whom has passed away. All her children go to school, and her husband is a teacher. 

Kavira works selling palm oil. She started her business with her own funds which she received from her husband. Later she received additional funds in the form of a loan from the Hekima microfinance institution around 2002, after the eruption of the Nyiragongo volcano. She sells her products at the market, and has had 22 loan cycles with the Hekima program. 

This new loan will be used by Kavira to buy six drums of palm oil. She also plans to buy a plot of land and build a nice house. She thanks the Hekima microfinance initiative for its actions helping poor women who are excluded from the traditional banking model.

loans.use: To buy six drums of palm oil.

loans.name: Dieu Seul Maitre Group

texts.fr:
Alfred est le coordinateur  de son groupe Dieu Seul Maitre. Il est  mariée et il e 4 enfants. Alfred habite dans la région nord d’Haiti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée.

Alfred  a dirigé son commerce vente des Produit alimentaires les dernières 6 années. Il  voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir  dans divers produits alimentaires. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à obtenir un plus grand commerce.

Des autres membres de sont groupe  ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme le charbonné le produits divers et cosmetiques.
texts.en:
Alfred is the coordinator of his group, which is called Dieu Seul Maitre. He is married, and has four children. He lives in the northern region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water supplies are very limited.

Alfred has worked selling food products for the past six years. He would like to use this loan to invest in his various food products, and hopes that the loan will help his business to grow

The other members of his group need a loan for various businesses, such as selling coal, miscellaneous products and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy food.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco Javier tiene tres hijos, es casado, empezó a trabajar a los 12 años de edad, estudia la carrera de ingeniería civil, ha logrado cubrir sus estudios hasta la fecha con los ingresos mensual de su trabajo, está solicitando el crédito para la cancelación del curso de titulación, actualmente trabaja en su propio negocio como técnico en proceso de aluminio y vidrio, siendo el mismo su jefe. Don francisco dice que la  finalización de su titulo es un esfuerzo muy grande el alcanzar un nivel de profesión, se beneficiara por que le ayudara a servir mejor en todo en su trabajo. Lo que comparte con otras personas del mundo es que sería un orgullo como nicaragüense poder servirle a otras personas necesitadas, por gracia de Dios.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier has three children and is married. He began working when he was 12 years old and is currently getting his degree in civil engineering. He has been able to cover his school costs until now with the monthly income from his job. 

He is asking for a loan to pay for his degree because he is working in his own business. He is his own boss working as a technician processing aluminium and glass. Francisco says that finishing his degree is a very big effort and it will allow him to reach a professional level. It will benefit him by allowing him to be better in all aspects of his work. 

What he shares with other people in the world is that as a Nicaraguan, it would be an honour to serve other people in need, by the grace of God.

loans.use: Pago de curso de titulacion

loans.name: Twibumbirehamwe Group

texts.fr:
Aloys fait partie du groupe Twibumbirehamwe . Le nom du groupe signifie « travailler commun». Il a 78 ans, il est marie avec 6enfants de 50 ans à 30 ans, dont. Il a 1 personne dans son charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de Primaire.

Aloys est agriculteur de riz. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimique et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz.

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de sollicite d’autre crédits. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait agrandir ces  champs de riz pour satisfaire les marchés. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer les frais académique de ses enfants et  payer les frais  médicaux pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Aloys is part of the Twibumbirehamwe group, the name of which means “working together”. He is 78 years of age, married, and has six children aged between 50 and 30. He has one other person under his care in addition to his children. He studied six years of elementary school education.

Aloys works growing rice, and this is his third loan cycle with ACB. He plans to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay labor expenses for his rice-growing business. To expand his business, he plans to request other loans. Over the coming years he would like to expand his rice fields, so that he can satisfy market demand. With his profits, Aloys hopes to pay his children’s education fees and cover his family’s medical expenses.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers and pay labor expenses for his rice-growing business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.fr: Judith est une jeune femme de 28 an s célmibataire ayant un enfant à sa charge. elle est coutière dans un quartier de la capitale et exerce son activité depuis 03 ans. Son esprit créatif lui a valu d'être connue par son voisinnage et le bouche à oreille aidant, elle s'est retrouver de plus en plus solliciter par une clientèle nombreuse et exigente. Ce crédit qu'elle sollicite, l'aidera dans l'achat  de pétits matériels (tissus, boutons ,fils...).Les bénéfices  venants de ce crédits lui permettront d'accroître son activité et de subvenir aux besoins d sa famille.
texts.en: Judith is a young woman who is 28 years old and single, with one child in her care. She is a dressmaker in one of the capital's districts and has been carrying out her business for the past three years. Her creative spirit has gained her recognition by her neighbors, and this recognition has been spread by word-of-mouth, so that she is in more and more demand from her numerous and demanding customers. The loan she is requesting will help her to buy small materials (fabrics, buttons, threads..). The profits coming from her loans will enable her to expand her business and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy small materials (fabrics, buttons, thread).

loans.name: Juliette

texts.en: Juliette, 34, has a boutique and has been selling different items for the past fourteen years. She wants another loan to add more merchandise for sale such as soap, cooking oil, and maize flour. Juliette wants to specialize in a boutique selling only products instead of mixing them with foodstuffs. With the profits from her business, she will build a house for her residence.

loans.use: to buy more soap, cooking oil and maize flour for sale.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Norashenik village with her husband and son. Gayane and her family members are involved in cattle breeding: they raise cows, hens and keep colonies of bees.

Gayane would like to increase the number of cattle, for which she needs sufficient funds. With the requested loan she plans to purchase two cows and two heifers. This will allow her to gather more income from the sale of agricultural products and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and two heifers.

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en:
Daphrose, 35, is married to an electronics specialist and they have five children who all attend school.

Daphrose has been selling charcoal for one and half years and now wants a loan to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from her business will be used to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Adeline, 41, is married to a businessman and has two children, who are enrolled in school. She sells skirts and blouses, a business she has been in for 15 years. She is very happy with the business because it has helped her to change her family life.

Adeline has requested a loan to add more stock of skirts and blouses for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more skirts and blouses for resale.

loans.name: Franciscar

texts.en:
Franciscar, 36, is married with three children, aged between four and 11 years. She describes herself as a calm and respectful woman. She operates a kale farm, a business she has been involved in for three years and employing two staff members. Her business is located near a busy market in her home town and her primary customers are business people from the market. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the failure of crops to sprout  before maturity.

Franciscar will use the loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy crops for sowing. Her business goal is to venture into a grocery retail shop business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be a supplier of kale.

loans.use: to buy crops of kale for sowing.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en: Clarisse, 25, owns a bar and has been running this business for two years. She wants a loan to buy more beer and alcoholic drinks for resale. With the profits from the business, she plans to build a house. Clarisse would like to see her business prospering in the future.

loans.use: to buy more beer and alcoholic drinks for resale.

loans.name: Calisto

texts.en:
Calisto is a single man. He has no children yet.  He describes himself as an easygoing and honest man.

He operates a butcher shop  where he sells meat and tomatoes. Calisto has been involved in this business for 7 years and employs 3 staff members. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge as low bargaining power with customers. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to pay for the renovation of his butcher shop to attract more customers to his business. His goal is to expand his business by opening another butcher shop within 5 years.

He hopes that in the future, he will be a prosperous and financially stable man. Calisto had received loans of KES 10,000, 20,000 and 30,000, which he repaid.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of his butcher shop

loans.name: Sonia De Los Angeles

texts.es: Sonia es originaria de Granada, casada, tiene 2 hijos entre las edades de 9 y 4 años respectivamente, ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de mariscos desde hace 10 años. A los 18 años de edad empieza a trabajar con su mama ya que era la dueña del negocio,  pero su mama enfermo. A la edad de 20 años ella quedo a cargo del negocio y hasta la fecha ha salido adelante con el negocio comercializando su producto en el mercado de la zona pagando mano de obra para que le ayuden en las ventas. Esta solicitando este crédito para compra de pescado, ella considera que este crédito le ayudara a abastecer el alto pedido con el que cuenta y sus clientes queden satisfechos de esta manera generara más ganancias, con esas ganancias espera mejorar su vivienda. Sus planes futuros son mantenerse siempre  como una gran proveedora de mariscos y seguir apoyando  a su mama.
texts.en:
Sonia is originally from Granada. She is married and has two children who are between the age of 4 and 9 years old. She is a storekeeper and she has been making a living from the sale of seafood for 10 years. When she was 18 years old she started working with her mother who was the shop owner.  At the age of 20 she was left in charge of the shop and until today she has managed to get ahead with the shop. She has achieved this by marketing her products on the local market and hiring day workers who help her with the sales. 

She is asking for this loan to buy fish. She thinks this loan will help her to meet the high demand she has and to keep her customers satisfied. This way she will increase her earning and with these earnings improve her home. Her plans for the future are to maintain her reputation as a great vendor of seafood and to continue supporting her mother.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано 47 лет,замужняя женщина, мать 4 детей.   Уже 15 лет занимается купле продажей  крупно рогатого скота и выращивает.   Знает все трудности и преимущество этого бизнеса.    Она умная и трудолюбивая женщина а также она любит помогать людям,которые нуждаются в помощи.   Поэтому в селе ее все знают и уважают.   А ее муж и дети помогают ей и поддерживают ее в бизнесе и в жизни. От полученного дохода они купили газель(муж занимается извозом людей),построили дом,а также она выдала замуж 2 дочерей.Теперь она хочет расширить свой бизнес и с надеждой она обратилась в нашу организацию и надеется на вашу помощь.   На полученный кредит  Рано хочет купить скот и увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Rano is 47 years old, married, and a mother of 4 children. For the past 15 years, she has been buying, raising and reselling cattle, and knows all the challenges and benefits of this business. Rano is an intelligent and hard-working woman who also likes to help people in need, which is why she is well-known and respected in her village. Her husband and children help and support her both in her business and in her personal life.

With Rano's business profits, the family has bought a minivan (Rano's husband transports passengers), built a house, and held weddings for their two daughters. Now, Rano would like to expand her business, and so she has turned to MDO Arvand, LLC for a loan to purchase additional cattle to increase the size of her herd. She hopes for your help.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia solicita este préstamo para pagar las inscripciones y la compra de uniformes de sus tres hijos quienes estudian la primaria.
La señora Lucia desde hace un año tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y artículos usados, el cual esta ubicado en su mismo casa y así no desatiende a sus hijos, su esposo el señor José elabora de una compañía de seguridad privada y entre los dos ingresos solventan los gastos familiares. Ellos son originarios de estado de Coahuila, pero ya tiene 15 años radicando en Nuevo Laredo.
Desean que sus hijos tengan el estudio necesario para una buena educación.
texts.en:
Lucia is asking for this loan to pay the registration fees and to buy uniforms for her three children who go to primary school.

For one year now, Lucia has got a small shop where she sells clothing and other second-hand items. The shop is situated in her own house. This way she does not neglect her children. Her husband works for a private security company. Together they cover the household expenses. 

Originally, they are from the state of Coahuila but 15 years ago they have settled in Nuevo Laredo. 

They wish for their children to study for a quality education.

loans.use: to pay school costs.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: Ana Lucia de 38 años, casado, con tres hijos, tiene por actividad economica la venta  de productos varios,Ana es de la localidad de chinandega, lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona muy comercial y muy productiva, la gente es muy trabajadora, luchadora, muy humilde con ganas de salir adelante. Ana dentro de sus pobreza y pocos recursos economicos ha logrado adquirir un terreno y ha iniciado con esfuerzo propia la construccion de paredes de su pequeña casita, pero devido a la falta de recursos es que no ha podido terminar. Ana esta solicitando el fiananciamiento para cumplir parte  de sus sueños y metas personales. Del financiamiento comprara material de construccion como. Zin, cemento, hierro, cal, alambre, perlines, madera, pintura, bloque, arena, entro otros. Ana agradece la ayuda que los prestatario kiva le brinda a los personas de escasos recurso y de paises pobres como lo es nicaragua. en la foto se muestra a la Sra. Ana indicando la contruccion que quiere y necesita realizara para darle un poco de seguridad y proteccion a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en: Ana Lucia is 38 years old and married with three children. She is a shopkeeper who sells various products. Ana is from Chinandega, a place characterized as a productive commercial zone, with hardworking, humble people, who are always fighting to get ahead.  While living in poverty with few resources, Ana has been able to acquire some land and with her own strength she has begun the construction of walls for a small house.  However because of the lack of resources she has not been able to finish.  Ana is requesting a loan to complete part of her dreams and personal goals.  With the financing she will buy construction materials like zinc, cement, iron, lime, wire, rafter supports, wood, paint, blocks, and sand, among others.  Ana would like to thank the lenders of Kiva who lend to people with scare resources from developing countries like Nicaragua.  The photo shows Ana indicating the construction she needs to finish in order to give her small children more protection.

loans.use: to buy metal roofing, cement, iron, mortar, tie wire, rafter supports, wood, paint, blocks, and sand, among others.

loans.name: Sharifbek

texts.ru: Шарифбек родился 1989 году в Гиссарском районе. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Жена Шарифбека домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном он продает детскую одежду и обувь. Торговлей Шарифбек занимается два года. Он берет кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Sharifbek was born in 1989 in the Gissar region. He is married and has a child. Sharifbek's wife takes care of the household while he works as a merchant at a marketplace. Sharifbek has been engaged in this activity for the past two years, and mainly sells children's clothing and shoes. He is taking this loan to increase his merchandise turnover.

loans.use: to purchase children's fall clothing

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa,  de 42 años de edad,  soltera con dos hijos  menores de edad que estudian, tiene por actividad la venta de sal,  para la comercialización, tiempo de tener el negocio 11 años, la cual inicio por la necesidad de tener un ingresos, la cual distribuye de forma ambulante, el financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: María Teresa is 42 years old and single with two young children who study. She sells salt, and has had the business for 11 years. She started her business by necessity to earn profits. She sells on a street market. She wants the loan to invest in working capital to satisfy the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy work material in bulk in order to distribute them at a better price

loans.name: Telson Misael

texts.es: Telson Misael de 30 años de edad, acompañado  con 4 hijos  de los cuales dos depende de sus ingresos, el desempeña como guarda de seguridad, el está solicitando el prestamos para hacer mejoras que consisten en cambio del piso de la casa, el cual desde hace un año no había podido realizar mejoras por falta de recursos porque el salario no le permite hacer la inversión por lo cual recurrió al préstamo, con el financiamiento comprara cerámica, cemento y otro materiales de construcción. Su sueño es arreglar bien su casita en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Telson Misael is 30 years old and has four children, two of whom depend on his income from working as a security guard.

He is requesting this loan to make improvements consisting of replacing the floor of his house, which he has been unable to do in the past year due to a lack of resources as his salary does not allow him to make the investment. Because of this, he resorted to a loan. With the financing, he will buy tiles, cement and other construction materials. His dream is to fix his house up well in the near future.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as tiles, cement and others.

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.es: NORMA TIENE 38 AÑOS, ES UNA MUJER CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS, ELLA SIEMPRE HA BUSCADO LA MANERA DE AYUDAR A SU FAMILIA, POR LO CUAL DESDE HACE 6 AÑOS SE HA DEDICADO A LA VENTA DE ROPA. TODOS LOS FINES DE SEMANA ELLA TIENE SU PUESTO ABIERTO EN UN TIAGUIS DE LA CIUDAD. Y ENTRE SEMANA ELLA VIAJA HACIA EL INTERIOR DEL PAIS PARA BUSCAR ROPA NUEVA Y ECONOMICA CON LA CUAL PUEDA OFRECER A SUS CLIENTES MEJORES PRODUCTOS. POR TAL MOTIVO NORMA SE VE EN LA NECESIDAD DE SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO, YA QUE LE HAN OFRECIDO UNA VENTA DE MERCANCIA DE ROPA NUEVA AL MAYOREO, CON LA CUAL ELLA VE LA POSIBILIDAD DE HACER CRECER SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en: Norma is 38 years old, she is married and has 3 children. She has always been looking for ways to help her family, which is why for the past 6 years she has been selling clothes. Every weekend she has an open stand in the city's market and during the week she travels inside the country to look for new and affordable clothes to offer better products to her customers. For that reason, Norma feels the need to request a loan, since she has been offered to buy clothes at wholesale, which she sees as a possibility to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru:
Бахтиёр проживает в городе Душанбе. Он холост. Ему 22 года. Его мать домохозяйка. Брат Бахтиёра находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации.  
Бахтиёр работает таксистом. Он уже два года предоставляет услугу. Бахтиёр берет кредит для ремонта своего автомобиля и установки оборудования для природного газа.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 22 years old and single. Bakhtiyor's mother takes care of the household, while his brother has left to find work in Russia. Bakhtiyor has been offering taxi services for the past two years. He is taking this loan to repair his automobile and to install the equipment necessary to use natural gas.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and to convert it to use natural gas

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru: Дилрабо трудолюбивая,пунктуальная а так же ответственная женщина.Она замужем,мать троих детей. Дилрабо всю свою жизнь занимается  откормом  скота.Этим видом деятельности она научилась с раннего детства.Это единственный доход в семье поэтому Дилрабо старается расширить бизнес и  хочет увеличит поголовья скота  и надеется на вашу поддержку.На полученный кредит она хочет купить скот и заранее благодарит.
texts.en: Dilrabo is a hard-working, punctual and responsible woman. She is married and a mother of three children. Dilrabo has been raising livestock all her life since early childhood. This is the only source of income for her family, and so Dilrabo would like to expand her business and increase the size of her herd by buying additional livestock with this loan. She hopes for your support and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Jose Lucio

texts.es:
Jose, se ha decidido por un prestamo para continuar invirtiendo en la siembra de granos básicos, sé que inicia la temporada en la cual deberá incurrir en los gastos de abono, herbicidas, pago de rastreo del terreno, que son necesarios para que el pueda realizar la siembra de maíz, este préstamo será un gran apoyo para la actividad agrícola, anque Jose realiza cualquier actividad comercial con el fin de mejorar o tener mayor seguridad en sus ingresos.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo en sus cosechas, ya que la inversión que realizó con los insumos agrícolas le permitió mejorar su calidad, ha tenido mejores resultados y por lo mismo sus ingresos han crecido para su familia.
texts.en:
Jose has decided to request a loan to continue investing in planting basic grains.  He knows that at the start of the season, he will incur costs for fertilizer, herbicides, and the payment of raking the land that are necessary so that he can plant corn.  This loan will be a big help with his farming activities.  Jose does several type of work in order to improve his income.
